Sugiro evitar os dias de visitação gratuita pois enche muito. Também vale a pena comprar o voucher do carrinho. Encanto para casais, famílias com crianças e pessoas de todas as idades.

O parque é lindo e muito agradavel! Fizemos em 2 dias e ach oque o tempo foi perfeito. No primeiro dia fizemos as obras mais proximas da recepção e no segundo dia, contratamos o transporte para as obras mais distantes. As distancias são realmente grandes e acho que o transporte é imprescindivel pois o terreno é bastante irregular. Almoçamos em dois restaurantes diferentes e em ambos achamos o atendimento bom e a comida honesta, apena so preço um pouco salgado. Mas definitivamente é um passeio recomendado!!! Vamos voltar!
Ver arte moderna misturada à jardins encantadores não é comum em nosso país. Inhotim está aberto a todas as idades e não há como se encantar.

Inhotim é um parque com galerias e obras de arte muito interessantes e um jardim botânico com várias espécies de vegetação. É bastante amplo e organizado. Pode ser visitado em apenas um dia, mas recomendo que se faça isso em 2 dias, para melhor proveito. No primeiro dia de visita a fila da bilheteria me assustou um pouco, mas posso dizer que vale a pena.
Arte e natureza juntos não tem como não ser perfeito! Se estiver por Belo Horizonte e tiver um dia de folga, deixe a preguiça de lado, alugue um carro e vá até Inhotim para passar o dia.

Mesmo não sendo grande fã de arte contemporânea, achei Inhotim incrível! O parque é de muito bom gosto, extremamente bem cuidado e com boa estrutura (inclusive para quem quer ir com crianças ou pessoas de mais idade). O paisagismo / jardinagem, assim como a arquitetura dos prédios, complementam a visita, tornando-a uma experiência imperdível!

um lindo parque com obras de arte agradabilissimas de ver, sentir e explorar. precisa de ao menos dois dias para ver tudo com calma. mas em um dia é possível ver as principais atracoes, mas com correria...
tem que ir preparado pra andar mas várias esculturas legais e várias salas que valem a pena ver.. como a sala que possui a sinfonia.

titulo: lugar muito bonito e com muito verde
conteudo:
lugar muito bonito e com muito verde, o stress do dia a dia não tem como não acabar com um paisagismo fantástico como esse.
O ponto negativo é o preço das coisas, TUDO é muito caro, mesmo supondo-se que o lugar seja uma atração sofisticada, alimentação principalmente é mais cara do que em um shopping center top.

titulo: Disney para os apreciadores de botânica e arte
conteudo:
Um jardim do Éden somado com galerias e arte incrível.
Lugar muito estruturado, com carrinhos de golf para àqueles que preferirem fazer o trajeto sentados, restaurantes muito bons e que atendem o mais simples e o mais sofisticado.
Monitores atenciosos e uma lojinha para souvenir para levar de presente ou lembrança.
A compra do ingresso pelo site tem uma taxa de serviço que encarece muito.
Preferi encarar a fila na bilheteria no primeiro dia e comprar um passaporte para 2 dias..
Vale a pena a visita, lugar lindo e agradável mesmo se voc~e não for um entendido em arte.

Inhotim é um dos lugares mais legais que já conheci! Tudo lá é muito lindo e parece ser planejado pra nos deixar de boca aberta a todo momento. Tem uma variedade imensa de obras de arte e instalações, muitas delas interativas. A instalação sono de Janet Cardiff, na minha opinião, uma das mais emocionantes. Além disso, no caminho entre uma galeria e outra você vai contemplando todo o trabalho de paisagismo e a natureza do lugar!

Incrível espaço de arte e botânica, muito bem conservado, excelente manutenção, ótimo atendimento.
Um lugar para ser conhecido e sempre visitado !

O Instituto Inhotim é uma referência como um museu aberto no Brasil, ao abrigar uma série de pavilhões e galerias com obras de arte contemporâneas de diversos artistas brasileiros e estrangeiros num espaço de convive com a natureza. Além das obras você pode desfrutar da uma exuberante e diversificada fauna nacional e internacional em seu entorno.
Sem dúvida, iniciativas como essa é rara no Brasil do ponto de vista de um colecionador é extremamente relevante para o Pais. Que se crie outros Inhotins neste Pais a fora.

Parque maravilhoso, museu fantástico, obras primas ao ar livre uma aula para todos. Nivel internacional. Vale a pena se hospedar em Brumadinho, local aconchegante e ir ao parque bem cedo, faz bastante calor. restaurante de ótima qualidade para almoçar e locais com lanches e sorvetes

Como amante da natureza recomendo a visita, local deslumbrante pelas belezas naturais e o melhor por contar com uma área bem estrutura, com serviços bem distribuídos para atendimento aos visitantes.
Para os que optarem por conhecer o local a pé, deve ter uma boa dose de preparo e coragem já que o parque é bem grande.
Quanto à questão das obras...! Realmente não entendo quase nada! Já que assim com minha esposa e eu imaginávamos ao programar essa visita, pensamos que iríamos encontrar obras com belezas inspiradoras..., porém não foi bem isso que encontramos.
Uma ressalva deve ser feita quanto aos preços dos objetos da loja de souvenirs, sinceramente fora da realidade.

titulo: Paisagismo e arte: a combinação perfeita acontece aqui!
conteudo: O Inhotim é lindo! O paisagismo surpreende o tempo todo e é incrível como as obras de arte e as galerias se encaixam perfeitamente à natureza. Consegui ver o parque todo em um único dia. Foi corrido, mas nada impossível. Também vi muitos bichinhos, como macacos, esquilos, patos... É um lugar muito bonito!! Recomendo a visita!

Estrutura fantastica, entrada franca nas terças feiras, muitas obras espalhadas, algumas interessantes outras menos.
Trenzinho p/ translado interno paga a parte mas acho que nao vale a pena, poucos trechos.
Va com tempo pra curtir a natureza e calor. Falta melhor estrutura de lanchonetes, sempre cheias

titulo: Deslumbrante, mas tudo é muito caro.
conteudo: A beleza é indescritível, só mesmo indo para compreender. Mas vale lembrar que a entrada é salgada e os comes e bebes lá dentro também são, então vá com o bolso preparado.

Inhotim é surreal. Volta e meia parecia estar dentro de um filme de Federico Fellini. No percurso de um belo e interminável jardim, avistam-se caixas enormes de concreto, de variadas e inusitadas formas, umas quase escondidas, como aquela que parecia fechada. Nessa, abrimos uma discreta porta de vidro e mergulhamos numa escuridão gelada, onde a luz brilha unicamente para revelar uma indescritível instalação de Lygia Pape. Foi apenas o começo de um passeio que ainda não acabou. Não dá para explorar tudo em um dia só, e isso é ótimo!

Visitei Inhotim, juntamente com minha esposa, em janeiro de 2015, num verão especialmente quente, com temperaturas na casa dos 30ºC. Como estava hospedado em Belo Horizonte, preferi deixar meu carro no hotel e contratei um motorista para a viagem de ida e volta até o parque. Serviço caro (R$300 mais o almoço do motorista), mas que vale a pena, pela distância (1h30 da Savassi),pelo estado das rodovias e pelo tráfego intenso que se enfrenta até lá. Há um dia na semana que o parque oferece entrada franca (terça ou quarta – é bom conferir). Chegando lá, havia uma pequena fila para adquirir os ingressos, que são bem caros. Ademais, deve-se reservar algum para o transporte interno feito em carrinhos de golfe. Sem meia entrada, ficou em torno de 50 reais por pessoa: ingresso e transporte. Sobre o transporte (questão crucial), creio que não dá para dispensar, pois o parque é grande e não é plano. Ao contrário, só há subidas íngremes e descidas idem. À pé, creio que só é recomendável para jovens (dos 15 aos 25). Se estiver fora dessa faixa, vá por mim e contrate o transporte. Mesmo porque você não poderá depender dele em toda a extensão do parque. Há vários trechos não cobertos e que só podem ser acessados com muita fé e suor, não necessariamente nessa ordem. Além disso, depois de uma certa quilometragem você acaba cansando e pensa em fazer o restante do percurso à bordo de um dos carrinhos. Pode esquecer. Eles já pensaram nessa possibilidade e organizaram o transporte de forma que o passageiro só possa fazer um trecho de cada vez. Você pensa em continuar, mas o motorista vai gentilmente convidá-lo a descer. O paisagismo do parque é seu ponto forte. Nisso, ele é espetacular. Sua cobertura vegetal, implantação e variedade de espécies impressionam. Já quanto à propalada coleção de arte contemporânea, bem...precisaríamos retroceder até a definição de arte...então...digamos que prefiro deixar de comentar sobre isso para não parecer grosseiro. Façamos o seguinte, vá lá e depois me diga o que achou (por sua própria conta e risco, claro). O ponto realmente negativo foi o restaurante self service – o mais próximo na hora do almoço. Um dos buffets mais sem graça que já vi. Comida pobre, ruim, sem gosto nem criatividade, verdadeira obra de indigência culinária. Além disso. O responsável pelo rancho (não dá pra definir de outro jeito) nunca ouviu falar em segurança alimentar. Um verdadeiro horror, com pegadores largados no meio das porções, cabos melados de comida por pessoas pouco cuidadosas e toda a sorte de porquindades (inventei essa palavra depois de percorrer o Buffet). Para finalizar, o preço é astronômico. Eu e minha esposa pagamos 140 reais por menos de 1 quilo daquela gororoba. Paguei, mas me senti lesado. Cuide-se.

Paisagem maravilhosa. Obras de arte modernas e pós modernas.
Interiores e exteriores. Local aprazível, agradável de visitar e também descansar. ótimo restaurante que cobra preços justos.
Veículo para transporte, se necessário. Lembranças para aquisição. vale apena visitar. Como fica distante de BH, quem não residir lá , será melhor hospedar-se em Mário Campos ou Brumadinho e aproveitar dois dias de visita.

Para quem gosta de passeios ao ar livre é uma ótima pedida, se gosta de arte também, muito interessante passear pelas galerias no meio de um paisagismo sem igual. O parque possui pontos com belas vistas dos morros que se encontram ao redor do parque, peca um pouco no serviço de alimentação, mas ainda não sei se isso é um erro ou algo pensado para não estragar os jardins com lixos bem na frente.

titulo: Visita obrigatoria para o amante da arte contemporanea
conteudo: O que não é exatamente o meu caso, mas foi uma descoberta interessante. Uma estrutura enorme, que exige muitas horas para desvendá-la totalmente, com algumas exposições instigantes, outras nem por isso. As facilidades ainda estão aquem do empreendimento, como a questão da mobilidade interna, falta de mapas de posicão, e do atendimento nas lanchonetes. E com toda a gama de facilidades de tecnologias da informação, o caminho poderia ser apetrechado de informações on line.

A aparência do parque mudou bastante desde a minha última visita há cerca de oito anos, mas continua lindo.
Houve uma grande expansão da área plantada e do número de galerias.Isto é, mais obras de arte e mais palmeiras e outras plantas em crescimento! Ficou tão maior, que mesmo chegando cedo, saindo no último minuto e abrindo mão do almoço, não pude rever tudo e nem conhecer todas as novas atrações. Para quem gosta de arte e natureza, quer descansar, 2 e até 3 dias são necessários para conhecer tudo e desfrutar o parque.
Os guias das galerias ou guarda-salas são muito bem treinados e gentis. Não perca as informações e faça todas as perguntas que desejar.
Assim, sugiro o mínimo de dois de visita e que os visitantes não deixem de pegar o carrinho elétrico para conhecer os pontos mais distantes. À pé, como tentei fazer é impossível, visto que nos dias de semana o parque fecha as 16:30.
Afora este ponto negativo, o acesso continua difícil por falta de sinalização nas cidades que se atravessa (pobres moradores !) e a conservação da área e disposição das plantas já não são mais a mesma. Porém, este último ponto - manutenção e paisagismo - não compromete o passeio. (Anos atrás era tudo muito perfeito)
Uma dica para os dias quentes:
chapéu e roupa de banho, uma vez que há duas obras interativas: piscina ao ar livre (Jorge Macchi) e outra fechada na Galeria Cosmococa.

titulo: Todo empresário brasileiro deveria ser amante da arte como é Bernardo Paz
conteudo: Lugar encantador, divino, bem idealizado, bem estruturado e com um paisagismo maravilhoso. Dois dias são necessários para descobrir as belezas do lugar e poder admirar todas as obras de arte. Faltando tempo para dois dias, vá com um mesmo. Todo brasileiro deve orgulhar-se de uma iniciativa como esse centro de arte congregando peças/obras de artistas brasileiros e estrangeiros. Coisa de primeiro mundo.

Maior museu a céu aberto do mundo, e certamente um dos mais bonitos também, Inhotin é um presente para quem gosta de arte.
Instalado em uma área de 110 hectares, o local abriga dezenas de obras de arte ao ar livre e outras 20 galerias com exposições permanentes e temporárias.
Além de artes o museu possui um paisagismo com centenas de especies de plantas do Brasil e do mundo.
Vale muito a pena a visita e se possível reserve dois dias

titulo: Imperdível para qualquer amante da natureza e das artes contemporâneas
conteudo: Fiquei simplesmente deslumbrada com tanta beleza natural e criatividade dos nossos artistas contemporâneos conjugados num mesmo ambiente. É um lugar que deveria ser visitado por todas as pessoas. Caminhei sem cansar pelo interior do Parque e Complexo museológico das 10h às 16h30 e consegui apreciar apenas a metade de toda a rara beleza que lá dentro se encontra. Terei de voltar outro dia porque nos perdemos nos detalhes das riquezas criadas por mãos divinas e humanas. Indescritível...
origem: São José dos Campos, São Paulo, Brazil

conteudo: Este local é único, além de ser um dos únicos no Brasil com tamanha diversidade de fauna e flora especificamente ligada a palmeiras imperiais de diversos tipos. Além de que, têm a possibilidade visitar diversos pavilhões com arte contemporânea. Prepare-se para um ou mais dias para conseguir uma visita completa. Para pessoas com dificuldade motora, tem carrinhos elétricos disponíveis e guias. Excelente visita em família ou amigos.

titulo: Lindo em qualqer época do ano!!!!
conteudo:
Volto novamente ao Inhotim em dezembro de 2014, e mais uma vez, fico encantada!!! Fui acompanhada do meu marido e de amigos paulistas, que não conheciam.
O encatamento é sempe o mesmo!!!!! Dessa vez, fui conhecer algumas galerias que não tinha visto em minha primeira visita. E a galeria Cosmococa, nos surpreendeu pelo banho de piscina e pelas redes e colchões, onde podemos tirar um cochilo, após um delicoso almoço no restuarante Tamboril, que aliás, eu recomendo!!!!!!

titulo: Deslumbrante e de muito bom gosto
conteudo: Inhotim é um museu a céu aberto. Um lugar mágico, bem desenhado. Feito para você querer ficar lá para sempre!!! Parece um lugar de contos de fadas. Se você tiver filhos, eles vão adorar!!! Não perca a oportunidade de ir a um lugar acolhedor e simplesmente FANTÁSTICO!

Ao lado de uma região de mineração e de uma grande metrópole, Inhotim se destaca como resistência.
As obras de arte que fazem parte de seu acervo são muito relevantes e bem bacanas. Aqui encontramos Oiticica, Ligia Pape, Cildo Meireles, Tunga, entre outros grandes nomes do cenário nacional.
A parte da botânica e do projeto paisagístico impressionam. Burle Marx se destaca aqui com seu estilo de agrupar vários indivíduos de uma mesma espécie para lhes dar mais visibilidade. Funciona demais!
Enfim, Inhotim é um lugar incrível!

Experiência única e linda, porque é de se encantar a primeira vista. Local belíssimo e as fotos então, ficam show de bola. Super conservado e sempre há exposições diversificadas a todo o tempo. Inovação é o nome e cada obra de arte e criatividade fora do comum. Amei.

Em Inhotim as obras de arte começam pelo paisagismo espetacular. A arte contemporânea está bem representada por artistas brasileiros e estrangeiros. Pela extensão da área, o carrinho extra para visitas de apenas 1 dia é uma boa pedida. A Uai Brazil Tour faz o passeio a partir de BH a um preço bem razoável, sem o ingresso. A mediação da visita feita pelo guia Horácio foi excelente não apenas propondo interpretações para as obras, mas estimulando a discussão com o grupo. Inhotim é IMPERDÍVEL!

Inhotim é surpreendente. Um lugar realmente especial. Fizemos a visita em dois dias. Acredito que desta forma pode-se aproveitar melhor o parque. Neste caso, opte pelo passaporte que da desconto. Nos hospedamos na pousada Estalagem do Mirante, que fica a uma hora de carro. Apesar da distância não ficaria em outro lugar. Uma vista deslumbrante e um ótimo atendimento.

O local é lindo, enorme e muito bem estruturado. É possível caminhar e conhecer obras de artes de vários artistas. Todos os funcionários são muito atenciosos e muito bem treinados. O local respira cultura e faz a gente se sentir parte integrante das obras. Simplesmente incrível. Não é possível expressar todo o sentimento vivido ali com palavras, é necessário ir para conferir pessoalmente. É necessário disposição para conhecer o Instituto inteiro em um único dia.

é um parque lindíssimo, com natureza exuberante e paisagens de tirar o fôlego. Abriga exposições itinerantes e fixas... vale muito a pena. Atenção!! Até 3 de fevereiro de 2015 a entrada é grátis às terças-feiras, após esse dia, será às quartas feiras. Aproveitem! É muito bom!

titulo: Lindo! Vale a pena a visita!
conteudo: O lugar é lindo! Muito bem cuidado e limpo! Bem estruturado e com acessibilidade, há banheiros e bebedouros espalhados em diversos lugares! Gigantesco: impossível conhecer tudo em um só dia, mesmo com transporte exclusivo (que foi o nosso caso)! Há 2 restaurantes: um buffet e outro self-service. A comida do restaurante buffet é deliciosa!!! Agora, em relação às galerias, sinceramente, gostei de pouca coisa... grande parte delas eu não considero arte. Mesmo assim, vale a pena a ida e uma futura volta...

IN-CRÍ-VEL!!!
Se puderem ir no meio da semana, visitará o local praticamente sozinho. Se o dia estiver muito quente, vele roupa de banho. O Local possui algumas piscinas.

titulo: MISTO DE MUSEU COM JARDIM BOTÂNICO
conteudo: Enorme jardim botânico com um espetacular museu de arte contemporânea, extremamente bem organizado e sinalizado. Com estrutura de países de primeira linha, em local totalmente inusitado para que ele estivesse, a pequena Brumadinho. A cidade deveria ter uma estrutura maior para suportar tal empreendimento.

Não tem como descrever de forma justa um lugar tão bacana! Bem cuidado, com acessibilidade. Não canso de ver as belezas naturais junto ao espetáculo das obras. Excelente lugar para passar o dia sozinho, com amigos ou família. Vale lembrar que tem que ir preparado para caminhada e para a exposição ao sol. No caso de chuva tem estrutura e guarda-chuvas disponíveis que não impedem em nada o passeio. Vale a pena pagar pelo ônibus para percorrer mais lugares. Se for com criança, há estrutura nos banheiros para atendê-los e lanchonetes no meio do caminho. A desvantagem é o alto preço, mas vale porque é bem empregado e não é todo dia se faz uma passeio desses. Quem é frequentador assíduo pode adquirir o passe. Dia de 3a feira não cobra a entrada, mas é bom conferir antes. Crianças também pagam.

Um banho de cultura artística e sobre a relação possível entre homem e natureza! É uma demonstração cabal de que temos um enorme potencial a explorar, seja do ponto de vista artístico, seja do ponto de vista cultural. Um passeio recomendável e para alguns, obrigatórios. Instituições de ensino deverriam incluir em suas programações pedagógicas e culturais.

Excelentes atrações distribuídas ao longo desse impecável museu a céu aberto.
O parque é muito bem cuidado e tem lagos e paisagens lindos.
Tudo é muito bem organizado e possui ótimos restaurantes. A lojinha na entrada/saída tem muitas obras legais e lembrancinhas do museu.
Sugiro comprar o transporte pois as caminhadas entre as atrações podem ser cansativas.
Fiz a visita em dois dias, para poder ver tudo sem pressa. Assim, pude conferir os dois restaurantes.
O Local é imperdível. Vale a visita!

Muito bom! Prepare as canelas!
Se caminha muiiiito! Mas, vale a pena. Não pegamos chuva...
Fiquei pensando como será percorrer todo o parque com chuva. Prepare-se!

Visitei Inhotim pela segunda vez, e fiquei tão encantada quanto da primeira. O jardim botânico é maravilhoso, muito bem cuidado, e proporciona paisagens belíssimas! As galerias são fantásticas, com obras que encantam e impressionam!! Tivemos apenas uma decepção... na sexta-feira, 02/01/15, o instituto não estava preparado para a quantidade de visitantes. As lanchonetes do parque estavam sem comida, tinham apenas bebidas. A pizzaria estava fechada. Tivemos que enfrentar uma fila super demorada no restaurante para conseguir comer.

Bonito, acessível, bem cuidado e guardado por pessoas muito competentes. Uma pena não ter uma publicidade maior. A cidade que abarca o museu parece ser indiferente à sua presença, ao passo de que ela é bastante maltratada. Poderia incentivar mais os comerciantes, taxistas e hoteleiros locais a centralizarem seus negócios em torno do Inhotim, uma vez que o município não pareceu ter mais a oferecer.

O melhor museu que já visitei, mexe com todos os sentidos de qualquer ser humano. Estrutura 100%. Limpo, tem banheiros e bebedouros por todos os cantos e cada exposição mais linda que outra. Ah, tem que ter disposição pra andar ou pagar R$20,00 a mais para poder usufruir de um transporte interno... Mas recomendo que andem bastante e chegue cedo...

Fizemos, em dezembro, nosso segundo passeio ao parque. É um programa imperdível. Natureza exuberante e arte se misturam. Visita à instalação sons da terra compensa a longa caminhada. Imprescindível calçado confortável e garrafinha de água.

titulo: Vá com tempo, muito tempo (e bom)
conteudo: mesmo quem costuma passar horas em museus precisa de mais tempo para aproveitar tudo de bom que tem pra ver e fazer em Inhotim, pode ser dentro de um dos pavilhões fechados de exposição ou simplesmente sentar em um dos vários espaços ao ar livre contemplando os lindos jardins.mesmo pra quem gosta e quer caminhar, é bom comprar o ingresso com o carrinho, para reservar os pezinhos para os passeios escolhidos. Mas mesmo com o carrinho incluído, não deixe de perambular a pé. Experiência inesquecível e imperdível.

O museu é um espetáculo! Todos devem conhecer! Mas deixo uma dica valiosa...se vc for com crianças ou idosos...compre já na recepção o passaporte para o transporte interno...só vendem na recepção...lá dentro a caminhada é linda porém extensa e cansativa e uma vez lá dentro não vendem mais o passaporte pelo caminho...não achei caro o preço da lanchonete no caminho da árvore suspensa...cachorro quente R$7,00 delícia! Outra dica... não escolha o caminho da BR 381 ou adentrando as cidades de Ibirité e sarcedo...pelo menos nas terças feiras quando a entrada é gratuita...dá um congestionamento gigantesco! Vá pela BR 040!

Simplesmente o lugar mais louco do mundo e um dos mais bonitos e agradáveis que já fui. Prepare-se para perder o fôlego a cada visada e se apaixonar muitas vezes, certamente você irá voltar. Cada metro quadrado é especial e bem tratado, o atendimento é excelente todas as pessoas são atenciosas e orgulhosas do lugar onde trabalham conhecem as exposições e os artistas e falam com prazer. Nunca vi nada parecido com isso fiquei muito impressionado e encantado. Se você so dispõem de um dia para visita eu aconselho o serviço de transporte porque inhotim é muito grande para um dia. Não vejo a hora de voltar.

titulo: Lugar ótimo para passar o dia!!!
conteudo: lugar naravilhoso onde você pode passar o dia e se divertir com a família e/ou amigos. Muito bem estruturado, com alimentação de boa qualidade e o visual deslumbrante. para todas as idades. super recomendo
Ótimo lugar para passeio no meio da natureza e muita arte, fique pelo menos dois dias e compre o ingresso com o carrinho pois é muito longe uma atração da outra
Adorei. Todos deviam conhecer. Museu de arte ao ar livre, super bem estruturado, limpo, funcionários bem treinados,bem sinalizado. Tudo de bom!
Must visit if this beautiful open air art gallery. Two days is better is better to see the area. I recommend wear shoes and buy the transportation to use inside the park.

Going to Brazil intersted in art, really? ok this is the place. Two days to see the various parts of the exhibition. An extraordinary experience that combines Nature art and the people looking at art i.e. you.

Highlight of my trip in Minas Gerais so far. I had the most amazing day exploring Inhotim. There’s a bus service which leaves the main bus station at 8:15 and then brings you back at 5:30 every day this cost around R$80 return and if you don’t have a car is probably the easiest way to get there. I bought the ticket that included the transportation inside, this was helpful as I only had one day to explore and it meant I didn’t have to spend as much time walking around. The art fits in seamlessly with the environment and it’s been very thoughtfully organised.

Ps. Take a towel!

What a surprise this place is. At almost 40 miles from Belo Horizonte, it's a journey that has you wondering why you're going. Not the most attractive drive but boy, you'll be glad you made it when you see what's there. With 23 Art Galleries set amid beautiful Botanic Gardens, you'll be well rewarded. One of the best days of our trip.
Wonderful park. Beautiful place. Organized and excelent . We could visit with family or with friends. Alone also. Restaurants and coffe bar in many places.
A place to go! Just incredible the open air museum they have there. We loved every inch of it. Will go back for sure!!!
Very good and a good guide! Both the botanical garden and the exhibition of the contemporary art. Something for the bucket list!

Wonderful place with fabulous landscaping and beautiful buildings. The works of art are amazing. It is a match of architecture, nature and art. The space is very well maintained with a lot of restrooms and a lot of beautiful benches to sit and enjoy the views. There are two very good restaurants and a lot of cafés.

Instituto Inhotim is a fantastic place. The nature is amazing. A lot of trees, lakes and modern art. The art galeries are spread throughout the park. There are a few cafes and restaurants. There is a shop at the entrance. The parking lot is big. If you don't want to walk you can take a golf-style car that goes round the park. It costs $30,00 reais. I believe it's worth taking it because you can see a lot in less time. Each car leaves you at a specific area where you may enjoy either the breathtaking nature or one of the art galeries. I really enjoyed listening to the sound of the Earth in one of the galeries.

This wonderful place totally deserves five stars. The grounds are just beautiful, with one lovely view followed by another, of the modern art, and nature’s own artwork, especially the lakes and palms.

If you want to wander around, admiring the plants, landscapes and views AND visit all the art galleries scattered throughout, you will definitely need two days. There’s so much to see, plus great cafes, restaurants and the design shop. I’m not a great fan of conceptual art, but some of the works were simply breathtaking. I’m not sure what they all meant, but I really appreciated the chance to experience them. I wish I could see them all again. I especially recommend the Tunga gallery, and don’t miss the glass exhibit upstairs.

You can take little golf-style buggies round the gardens, for an extra 30 rais for the day. If you’re over 60, take some form of identification, with your dob, as this allows you entry half price. This applies to a lot of Brazilian tourist sites, so well worth doing.

Anyway, this place is well, awesome. Do go.

titulo: A Botanical Garden Planted with Modern Art
conteudo: I don't know of another attraction in the world quite like Instituto Inhotim (perhaps on a small scale the deCordova Sculpture Garden near Lincoln, MA). Inhotim is a vast botanical garden planted with outdoor modern art sculpures and installations. Some of the art is housed in various pavillions around the grounds. Expect to spend the entire day here. There are carts to transport visitors around the grounds, but some walking is required. Fortunately, there are also numerous restaurants, cafés, and gift shops to rest tired feet and recharge. All are as immaculate as the gardens themselves and the exhibits. Whether you are an afficionado of botanical gardens or modern art or simply enjoy nature, Inhotim is not to be missed. It is without a doubt one of Brasil's great attractions.

I expected the art to be cool and it is. Very accessible modern art exhibits. What surprised me was the spectacular grounds. I've been to Butchart Gardens and many other wonderful arboretums in the States. This is my favorite park. Ever. Beautiful, well established gardens interspersed with water, architecture, and beautiful topography. I can hardly wait to go back. We saw about 1/4 in 4 hours.

titulo: The most enjoyable and playful museum in the world!
conteudo: It's a must-go place for a vacation trip to Brazil! We spent 1.5 days there and felt not long enough. The art works melt with visitors in the beautiful garden and created lots of fun, every one's experience would be unique! Very enjoyable! We ate in a couple of food courts. The meals were fresh cooked and tasted good!

titulo: Good way to spend a day
conteudo:
My colleagues recommended this place to me, for something to do around Belo Horizonte. It is a large park in Brumadinho, with a large variety of contemporary art exhibitions. Besides the art, some trees and plants are marked for being special, and there are some special gardens such as a desert garden, a mata atlantica garden, etc.. In various places there are coffee bars, a juice bar, a hamburger tent, and probably also proper restaurants.

There are I think about 20 different buildings with art exhibitions. In addition, there are some works of art in the open air, and I tend to prefer the latter type. One of the art highlights is the dotted room by Yayoi Kusama.

titulo: Wonderful botanical garden, interesting contemporary art exhibition
conteudo: The botanical garden is wonderful, and exceptionally well kept / managed. Thousands of botanical species focusing first on endangered species. The contemporary art exhibitions are interesting for some of them, even surprising in some cases, but the main attraction is Nature

Fantastic mix of botanical garden and 23 (!) modern art galleries in an area of 140 hectares. Stay 2 days if you possibly can to have more time to enjoy the nature.
Some practicalities for individual travellers: There is one direct bus in the morning from Belo Horizonte which takes you back after closure (eventhough websites like clickbus don’t show the return journey!). Bus company “Saritur”, leaving from the central bus station (Rodoviaria), buy ticket at ticket area no. 9 on level no. 2, bus then leaves on level no. 1, platform F2. 78 Real per person for return ticket. Leaves at 8.15, returns after closure which was 5.30 on the weekend. Passport was needed for the purchase of the ticket.
Entry ticket is 44 Real, the electric carts are 30 per person. As a person with disabilities (I think also for senior citizens above 60), the accompanying person was free of charge and both could use the carts for free! Also other discount groups (students?) available, but don’t remember the details. 2 days and 4 days entry tickets available.
The websites features accommodation options in the area. Next time I would try to stay in the area to enjoy it even more!
Park map included.

titulo: A great place for a day out
conteudo: I've actually been to this place several times and have still to see all it has to offer. It's a vast space and has most of the native Brazilian plants. Make sure you arrive early to make the most of the day.

titulo: The best park in the country
conteudo: Inhotim is a very, very big park built in a farm, where you can see nature at it’s best, and also artistic exhibits. It takes 2 days to see it all, and if you don’t have that time, study the places you want to go first. It’s like going to a very big Disney park, so put on nice shoes, take mosquito repellents, a backpack, water and snacks. You’ll find places to buy snacks along the trails and very good (although a bit expensive) restaurants closer to the entrance. If you have any walking restriction, you can pay extra and ride a golf car around the park. A must go place in Brazil, very unexpected and unforgettable.

titulo: A year of absurdly high expectations exceeded in every way
conteudo: There are times when five stars just really can't convey how astonishing something is. More than a year ago, we saw an episode of Parts Unknown in which Anthony Bourdain visited Inhotim. We immediately began researching and planning a visit (which grew into a two-week adventure in Brazil with several friends). We expected Inhotim to be beautiful. And fascinating. And strange. In fact, it's transcendent. And weirdly funny (in a joyful way -- you find yourself literally laughing from surprise and happiness). It refilled my sorely tested well of optimism. Since I can't possibly write a better review than my friend mhmason below, I'll just refer you to hers. And amplify her credit to Tiago dos Santos, of Belvitur Travel, who was our incomparable guide. Go to this place.

I absolutely loved this place! It is important to plan your visit so you have enough time to see all it has to offer. We arrived by noon and I was sorry we had to leave without visiting some areas of the park.
The gardens are impecable and full of exotic flowers and plants with information about them.
There are clean restrooms all along the different trails and art areas.
It was an adventure to enter each one of the art exhibitions, because behind each door there was a unique art piece or something that would impress your senses.
It was worth the visit.

titulo: It is CRAZY to me that everyone in the world doesn't go to Inhotim,...
conteudo:
Although then, I suppose, it wouldn't be quite as fantastic and moving an experience. Part of me wants Inhotim to stay a well-kept secret (at least from folks in the US) because I am afraid we might spoil it, but my trip there was so unique, it wouldn't do the justice to it if it weren't shared. There is very little, or at least very little useful, about Inhotim in guide books. It ranks a paragraph here, a few sentences there. So I searched a bit on the internet, and still didn't get a real sense of it. The only reason we had heard about it was because we had seen it on an Anthony Bourdain episode. But even that didn't give you a sense of the real awesomeness of the place.

So first things first, some of the practicalities. First, time: We were there for two days, easily could have spent more time, and wish we had. Second, accommodations: I am separately reviewing Solar Maria Carolina as a place to stay, which is about 25 minutes away, and I highly recommend that. Third, a guide: It really helped the first day to have a dedicated guide. We got a guide through Inhotim itself (you must arrange this is advance), and Tiago really capped the first day. He didn't just point out various installations, or artists, but took us through a thoughtfully curated selection (and gave recommendations for the following day when we were on our own). He was smart, funny, observant, and was just a delight to be around. We talked (there were six of us and Tiago) about the art, artists, their motivations, the political and historical contexts. All in flawless English (his, not ours). And before I get you thinking that Inhotim is some sort of boring art history lesson, it isn't, as I hope I can convey below. All this is just to say Tiago really deserves his own, separate five-star review. Fourth, a golf cart: Ok, I know people reading this review are going to say, I'm in great shape, I can hoof it. And you could. If you have a couple of weeks to look around, and want to spend any time with any piece. There are three options: only walking, a hop on hop off golf cart, or a dedicated golf cart and driver. We did the dedicated cart for the first day, with some folks opting for the hop-on-hop off cart for the second day, and others walking. We all agreed that the combination of the dedicated cart and driver (and guide) really maximized what we could see and experience for the first day. Fifth, clothes. Even if you get a dedicated cart (which is really a must if you are only staying there one day) , you are walking, a lot, and need to be in comfortable clothes and shoes (tevas or good walking shoes). There are several times where you need to take your shoes off and on, too. And bring a bathing suit! That's about all I can think of in the practical realm.

As for the place itself? It is audacious. Reverential. Experiential (there are a number of installations you interact with). At various times hilarious and haunting. Inhotim is a 1200 or so acre mix of outdoor art installations, and small and large galleries - some pieces in their collection are permanent, some not. And when I say art, I mean art broadly defined. The grounds themselves are are living, breathing, botanical art, marked throughout by these beautiful almost prehistoric benches made from fallen trees. The actual pieces of art, though international, had a decidedly Brazilian flavor, which itself enhanced the experience of all six of us who went (four of whom had never been to Brazil). I know I keep using the word experience, but that's really what Inhotim is. I could write on foreover about it, or describe some of the particularly profound, to me, moments or installations. But to select one almost seems to do a disservice to the whole. So you are just going to have to experience it for yourself! My one criticism? The gift shop needs better postcards,... Seriously!!!!

This is a lovely garden in it's own right, with many art galleries as well. The at is contemporary and modern. We really enjoyed the galleries we visited, especially the G-10 on the map where you can hear the sound of the Earth. You really need either the car pass and a very busy day, out really 2 days, to see everything.

We didn't get the car pass, and except for the trail going up to G10 the hills weren't bad.

We should have stayed in Belo Horizonte instead of Brumadinho though. We managed to get an Uber to the garden, but got stuck taking a taxi back at 3x the Uber price. Also, there's a lot more to do/eat in BH.

titulo: Take a day to enjoy this park  and the galleries it offers.
conteudo: I did not know exactly what I was going to see. I understood there were art installations but not that many were small galleries. Excellent variety of modern art, photography, history of the area and culture. Highly recommend paying the bit extra for golf-cart access. It is beautiful to walk around the areas, and you still can, but you will see a lot more if you do the longer treks by cart... also can be very hot!

Every piece of it is beautiful. Gardens and architecture are very well designed with good harmony.
There are nice options of restaurants too. It’s worth it.

titulo: Visit this place on a Tuesday
conteudo:
Wednesdays are free entry so I heard there are a lot of people visiting the park that day, as well as weekends. I recommend you go on a Tuesday, that’s what we did and there must have been only 15 people in the park that day. Entry fee is 44 reals and 30 extra if you want to use there golf cart to move around the park, but that is not necessary.
Note that the place is closed on Monday.
We managed to get an Uber back to Belo Horizonte for 80 reals.

We spent a full day at Inhotim and it was beautiful We chose to go on a Wednesday and it was free admission so that was a nice bonus. We used the Saritur bus from Belo Horizonte (departs at 8:15 and returns at 4:30 pm) and that worked very well and gave us the full day to explore Inhotim. Many people recommend getting around on the golf cards but we walked everywhere and that was fine although it was a very hot day. The gardens are amazing and we didn't see everything with only a single day. Similarly all the art is wonderful and again we weren't able to see it all with just one day. We had lunch at the the buffet restaurant which was quite good and reasonably priced (there was quite a line up to enter at the opening time). I have a hard time really describing Inhotim as it's such a special place. The gardens are really beautiful with lovely paths everywhere. The art is contemporary which isn't usually my favorite but I saw lots that I liked. Very interesting and enjoyable day.

Like some other reviewer wrote here: Art and nature belong together. That's what the owner wanted to say when he created this outdoor museum.

Briefly, I want to tell my highlight of the park: It was a place something like red room. In there, everything, like furniture, objects and TV, telephone are red. Quite peculiar, going ahead you see a dark room on your left. I dont want to spoil it but looks like a scene from Resident Evil, the water was red like it was blood. Hahaha
I loved it.

Overall the park is really beautiful and great to chill in a hot summer day, full of trees and trunk benches (another piece of art).

Food is quite good in the restaurant (I went in the one close to the entrance), there are 3 if I am not mistaken.
What a place! My family and I are great museum fans and Inhotim is one of a kind. There is not enough adjectives to describe it. You have to go there and see for yourself! You won't regret!

In Inhotim, you will find hundreds of works of contemporary art (painting, scupltures, iinteractive installations, films, photos), by artists from all around the world. And they are presented right in the middle of a wonderful botanical park.
It is about an hour away from Belo Horizonte, by car, and 1 1/2 hours by bus. But it is well worth it. I have been there four times during the last 15 years, since I live in Belo Horizonte, and they have new exhibitions every year.

We were so surprised how beautiful this place is. We only visited for 1 day so we bought the car transfer, we were able to do it all but in a rush so 2 days are much better. Anyway this is. Place to be visited!

It’s hard to put into words how amazing Inhotim is. Unfortunately my hubby and I had only one day to spend over there. I’d say, if you have more than a day available, buy their passport and plan to go back the next and - why not - the following day.
The museum is huge!!!
Also, I think paying R$30 for the cart is a must. The cart takes you to strategic spots, then you can walk and spend as much time as you want exploring. You save some time (and energy) walking up the hills.

Another thing important to be mentioned is that you can swim over there!!!!! There were at least two pools people are allowed to swim. I wish I had my bathing suits on me... it was hot as fire!

The staff were extremely helpful and nice, the souvenir store was like a paradise (some things very expensive, but totally worth), and the restaurants great.
I can’t find anything wrong or bad about that place. We’ll definitely go back when we come to Brazil!

Absoloutely wonderously beautiful place. It was the highlight of my trip! Go early and spend at least a whole day. If you can only go one day make sure to get the wrist band so you can hop on the golf carts; otherwise you wont see everything. The restaurants and gift shops are pricey, so bring extra money.
It is simply gorgeous here. Be sure to make it a whole day venture, and bring your camera!

We spend two days in Inhotim, walked all the paths because this gives a better opportunity to fully enjoy the wonderful park. But you can also take golf carts if you want, because it is big. Although we weren't lucky with the weather, we enjoyed every minute.
Great architecture, very large variety of exhibitions, so that you always find something of your interest. Even the restaurant and bistrot we visited there were surprisingly good.
This visit was worth every penny, even for international standards !

titulo: Unmissable spot for food, views, and experiences
conteudo: Galleries to explore the senses, superb food, picture-perfect sceneries... this place is just amazing! I split my visit in 2 days, so I had the opportunity to visit pretty much all the galleries, and most of the gardens. Highly recommended! Also, buying tickets online saves you significant time.

titulo: Fantastic garden, different art pavilions and tasteful food: this is INHOTIM
conteudo: Many pavilions filled with contemporary art that makes one wonders what really art is about. Plus the huge garden in over 50 acres has so many different trees and plants that this is a reason to be there. Lunch at Tamboril Restaurant at this 15th visit to INHOTIM had a good surprise beyond the good food: an incredible mixed salad combining several ingredients with a superb mustard sauce. It had a pear cooked in passion-fruit juice that was so tasteful we ask to congratulate the chef. Keep on going like this, Inhotim!

Inhotim is a truly beautiful place in Minas Gerais. It combines a huge botanical garden and galleries with modern art. It's definitely worth visiting! Be ready to walk a lot because the place is really big!

titulo: The perfect combination of nature and art
conteudo: Our full day visit was just enough to see this beautiful open air art and nature park. The combination of art galleries in the middle of a huge botanical garden really works. Altough its a lot of walking (there is tranport within the park by the way) you dont really notice that you walk a lot. Mainly because there is so much to see. A definite mist see when you are in the area

titulo: An absolutely thrilling experience at the mountains of Minas Gerais ...
conteudo: So much has already been said or written about Inhotim. I'll just say: it is beautiful, thrilling, unmissable and absolutely a must-see at any visit to Brazil. Arriving in Belo Horizonte (the capital city of Minas Gerais State and the nearest airport), rent a car and head to Brumadinho (the nearest city and with the best lodging options). Spare a minimum of two full days to visit the park. Hiring an electric mini car (similar to those used at golf courses) with a driver/guide is strongly recommended. Now, you are all set for your visit to Inhotim! The park opens at 9:30AM and closes at 4:30 PM on weekdays and on 5:30PM on weekends and holidays. Many eating options are available, but Restaurante Tamboril, with its fantastic buffet lunch by acclaimed Chef Daildes Marinho, is another must. Contemporary art and a manicured botanical garden await you. Enjoy!

titulo: World class art and a wonderful, troptical, botanical garden.
conteudo: Setting world class art in a beautiful, tropical, botanical garden is a terrific idea. Inhotim is a lovely place to look at modern art and architecture, stroll through the trees and gardens, sit and listen to the sounds of the tropics, and eat or drink at one of the many restaurants spread out through the facility. We spent two half days there, and could easily have spent another full day. The art is international and very very good, the grounds and buildings are modern and immaculate, and the setting is simply wonderful. If I were to visit only one place in Brazil, it would probably be Inhotim.

I´ve heard about Inhotim from many friends. They all told me amazing stories about the place but I couldn´t imagine how big and impressive it is. Well organized, clean, all the instalations, and places are amazing. A must go!

Clearly a most fascinating destination for contemporary art! The beautiful landscape has been designed to keep you captivated as you wander between pavilions and artworks.I spent 3 days there and wanted 2 more.Definitely get the golf cart pass as there are hundreds of acres to cover - otherwise you'll run out of time. Not a place for most kids. I stayed in Belo Horizonte at the Holiday Inn so taking the shuttle to the park would be easy. It's a 45 min ride to the park.

This open air museum in the middle of a botanical garden is awesome. Housing almost 20 galleries of modern art exhibitions with visual,auditorial and sensorial sensations. Impossible to visit in one day, and if you enjoy modern art plan for three days

Beautiful gardens landscaped with contemporary art. Nice insight into the Brazilian culture and inspiring scenarios throughout. Make sure you drink plenty of water and wear comfortable shoes for your visit. 4 hours visit at least. Tip: Free entry on Wednesday, use your spare cash for transportation within the park.

Would be a 5/5 perfect place to visit, considering its natural exhuberant beauty and all, but the staff is slightly underprepared. Hard to find someone who speaks English or Spanish (even at the store!) and some of them kept talking loudly inside galleries, which should be silent places. Other than that, it's an amazing experience even for those (like me) who are not enthusiasts of contemporary art, so I totally recommend everyone to go there! :) Make sure you got 2 days spare to visit it all!

titulo: Great place to all ages - art, photography and nature
conteudo:
Inhotim is a place near Belo Horizonte which is really worth to visit. Most people will get surprised with its exibitions (the permanent and the itinerant ones). The beauty of its gardens, lakes and open sky masterpieces. Take casual clothes, a hat, sunscreen, bug reppelent, a camera and prepare to walk and get astounished.
A must visit for art, museum and nature enthusiastics.
On wednesdays the fee is free.
Best thing to do for couples or groups of friends: rent a car, get the reservation on one of the Pousadas/hostels/hotels at Brumadinho and enjoy the 2 day visit.

titulo: Botanic Garden Integrated with Contemporary Art
conteudo:
Must see.
My wife, a couple of friends, and I have spent two days within Inhotim Museum and park.
It is marvelous, awesome, incredible, and amazing.
It is a must to hire a tourist guide to explain all the botanic landscape arrangement with ponds, plants and trees from all over the world as well as the interpretation of all contemporary arts exposed and fully integrated with the surrounded nature.
We hired Junio Cesar +55 31 96600164 a guide who lived inside Inhotim even before it was idealized, and witnessed all the gardens and art galleries being brought into reality.
It takes you at least two days to experience Inhotim, including the gastronomic experience you should indulge yourself. As Chef Dailde invites you to enjoy modern Brazilian and Minas Gerais food, we also suggest you to have lunch at Tamboril restaurant, and try the delicious “ pão de queijo” (cheese bread) at Cafe Flores.
Listening to all the stories of Inhotim was a delightful unique experience,and I can tell you I have not seen anything similar in the world.
So put this in your bucket list!

titulo: Best open air museum in the world
conteudo: Incredible, a mixture of museum and botanical garden. Well worth visiting Brazil just to spend a couple of days exploring Inhotim. The family and I loved every second of our day at this wonderful open air art gallery. Totally different from any other place in Brazil or the world. Here visitors are free to walk, or ride on carts, to explore this new wonder of the world. There are tour guides to assist or you can create your own itinerary. Along the way there are top quality restaurants and snack bars to satisfy even the most demanding costumers. I found it very clean and well maintained. Which is quit unusual for Brazil. With the aid of a tour map anyone can have a day of adventure exploring the details that make Inhotim one of the best museums of its class.

I had high expectations based on the reviews but I did not like it at all. Nature is pretty but the art galeries are crap. Seriously, I don’t understand how they can call it art... Must work is dumb and unmeaningful. For me, the only art gallery that worth the entrance is G23 (Galería Claudia Andujar) which host a collection of photographs from the Amazons and the Yanomami tribe. Don’t go unless you really really love contemporary art.

I've been to Inhotim several times and have always loved the experience. My nephew was visiting from the US, so I decided to take him out today, Wednesday, when the admission is free. That was a big mistake. The place was absolutely overrun, and the experience was unpleasant from start to finish. Lines for absolutely everything, from food, to bathrooms to entering the exhibitions. A huge disappointment and a waste of a day. Moral of the story: don't go on Wednesday!

titulo: Don't go unless you get contemporary art
conteudo:
It is very well set up for travellers. The gardens were wonderful. There are some restaurants, including a cheaper buffet, which was nice (I'm glad they don't charge you an unreasonable amount). Bathroom facilities are great. Staff are awesome. They have a tram system which can speed things up. You definitely need a long day to fit everything in - we were there for over 4 hours but didn't see the whole park.

On the other hand, I really really did not get this place. I'm no art connoisseur, but I do appreciate it and have been to many museums around the world. it did not wow me at all. There also weren't that many installations - it was a lot of walking between them. It was a very odd place. The most memorable was the musical exhibit, where there all these speakers around the room. That gave me chills - this is the type of thing I expected to see more of.

I went out of my way to see this place but was disappointed. Given the thousands of other people that have enjoyed it, I guess I just have to say it wasn't my taste!
Beautiful place! A perfect combination of nature and art. The place is very well prepared for tourists. Loved it!

Inhotim seems to be out of this world. Combination of art galleries, outdoor art and botanical gardens, this place is a must and everyone will love it, regardless of age, gender and art background. If you cannot make it in two days, at least make sure you arrive when they open, because the place is huge and there are lots of things to do and see. If you buy tickets online you avoid lines, get also the electric car or you will waste a lot of time going to the farther galleries.
The park is beautiful and very pleasant to spend the day walking around the galeries, arts and gardens. Reserve two days for a complete overview of the park.

A remarkable venue for the huge variety of plantlife and gardens alone. Various exhibit centers and sites on the expansive property offer something for everyone. I must admit it seemed more heavily weighted toward avant garde than traditional. Photography, sculpture and painting abounds, but mostly what I would describe as non-traditional. Glassworks, ceramics, metal, fabric are all on display. Some exhibits may be disturbing, especially the photo exhibit featuring sexual exploitation and prostitution. Others might find some exhibits offensive or in poor taste. It was a most unusual experience for an unsophisticated art viewer, but overall worthwhile as it is among the highly acclaimed art exhibitions existing today. That it is literally carved out of the wilderness and outside an urban center makes it unique.

If visiting Brazil and you're close to Belo Horizonte, do not miss a visit to Inhotim. Luckily, I learned about Inhotim from a Brazilian woman on the plane and I'm so grateful I did! It's considered a museum but it's much, much more than that! The art and sculptures are displayed outdoors as well as indoors. The exhibits are modern and very interesting! You walk along paths under beautiful shade trees, all around beautiful gardens and lakes. It's breathtaking! I took so many beautiful pictures all of my Canadian friends want to visit it in person! We walked from when it opened and until it closed and only saw 60% of the exhibits! You can ride a trolley but we didn't want to pay for it. We ate breakfast and had a nice lunch there. Admission to Inhotim is free on Wednesdays!

titulo: Great place for a family trip
conteudo: We went to Inhotim in a group of 7 couples and 3 babies under 3. Great experience: world class art (but also great emphasis on contemporary Brazilian artists), jaw dropping landscaping, good restaurants and first world infrastructure inside the park. Plenty of space for kids to run around. All in all, an incredibly enjoyable experience for both parents and kids.

Visited with our guide Rafael Assis Inhotim. Thanks to Rafael we made most of the day we had! Outstanding service at an outstanding place. Open your mind and wander among the beautiful gardens to get familiar with modern art. Very inspiring! Great for a day trip, but definitely better if you have two days with a guide.

Grounds are beautiful, the architecture of the galleries is interesting, most of the art will only be appreciated by those with a taste for modern and avant-garde gsrde pieces. Get a cart ticket to save your legs from excess walking.

Our daughter, who lives in Sao Paolo, had been to this attraction before but insisted we needed to see it while touring the Estrada Real. She had tried to describe it...but it far exceeded our expectations. It cannot be described - only experienced.

We were there for a few hours on Wednesday when admission is free and returned the following day for the entire day. That was not enough time to see the Contemporary Art Center and Botanical Garden. At the end of the second day, I resorted to a golf cart to see A14 Beam Drop just before closing at 4:30 PM.

On Tuesdays and Thursdays, it is R$ 25. On Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and holidays, admission is R$ 40. Half price for senior citizens (60+) and students (upon presentation of valid school/college ID). A great value.

We had lunch at Restaurant Tamboril both days. For 4 people, the buffet on the first day came to R$379 without beer or wine; the second day we did the Prefixe lunch and it came to R$374 for 4. About US$110 to 115 - very good quality meals - it may have been a little pricey but seemed to be the best dining option for us.

Great place to visit even if you’re not into modern contemporary art. It’s definitely doable in one day, and I strongly recommend hiring the golf cart (unless you reaaally like walking, and has time to spare). I’m not into modern art so I just highlighted the main “attractions” and went for it. But the park in itself is amazing, even in the rain, it’s clean, well maintained, nice staff to guide you through, good options for food. There’s parking lot, and they offer antibug sprays. Bring sunscreen, an umbrella and a water bottle so you can refill it. Because of the Yellow Fever they do ask for your vaccination card. We didn’t have ours , but we were vaccinated, so we just had to sign a form that said that we were entering at our own risk.

Uniquer setting of modern sculptures sprayed out in a stunning garden, with art galleries and individual features well integrated with nature, cant miss it. The only concern during the summer season (December - March) are the recent Yellow Fever occurrences, so please ensure you have a valid Yellow Fever vacine certificate with you.
wonderful park with several pieces of art and sculptures. a place to spend a day enjoying the atmosphere and the peace around
BE SURE to bring proof of Yellow Fever vaccination. Beautiful location, with various art installations. I can take or leave the art, but enjoyed the natural element.

titulo: Nature is art and art in nature
conteudo: If I had more than five stars, I would easily give them to the Inhotim Museum. Truly a piece of art in itself. The only to describe it is telling you that a visit is a must. Starting this month they require yellow fever vaccination card, and they have added 3 new installations just last year. The installations are huge and any artist would dream exhibiting there. Go, just go!

titulo: If you love arts and nature, you must go
conteudo:
The open air museum is near the small village of Brumadinho, hearted in the Minas Gerais, about 1h30m distance from Belo Horizonte.

I went on my own, driving my car through Estrada Real, from Rio de Janeiro, until get to Brumadinho. I do recommend book a hotel close from the Museum. I stayed at A Mi Manera, 40km from the park, and I were welcomed by the lovely owner, Yvine, which also is a great cheff.

Inhotim is a huge park with 23 art galleries, spread in a beautiful botanical garden with a range of variety trees, lakes and fauna.

You can see sculptures in the garden or enjoy the galleries. It's necessary at least 3 days to see all Inhotim Museum. There you can find masterpieces made by Tunga, Adriana Varejão, Lygia Pape, Yayoi Kusama, Zerbinni, among other famous contemporaneous artists.

It's a very pleasant sight and tour, where you can relax, see some art, emjoy the nature.

There are lot of restaurants and coffee shop options inside the park, from Italian, to Brazilian food, hamburgers and vegetarian options.

One good tip, on Wednesday entrance is for free. You can also buy a 3 days passport.

Another tip, don't forget your comfy tennis shows, at Inhotim you'll have to walk a lot, even if you buy the ticket for the shuttle service inside.

There are also fountains for hydration in the whole park. Bring your own bottle, trust me, you'll need it.

Finally, enjoy Inhotim, the garden and art!

I hope I can back soon.

titulo: Great botanical garden with superb modern art
conteudo: Inhotim is like no other place. The botanical gardens are very well done an the staff are uniformly knowledgeable. The art exhibitions are in dedicated buildings devoted to single artists/topics. Inhotim is worth the trip.

Two days are needed to discover the whole place. The nature is outstanding. Palm trees, tropical flowers, unbelievable number of plants are nurtured and develop in this amazing and huge terrain.
The installations are as well incredibly numerous and some of them unforgettable.
Take your time, enjoy the land, the walk, the discovery. Take pictures, stop, enjoy, wait, listen... it’s a place for our senses.
We absolutely loved it.
A must for nature and contemporary art lovers.

The Inhotim botanical garden is well developed and houses lots of modern art. The art can be seen in the open, but also in a number of galeries within the park. The park is rather big and combined with the high temperatures and humidity, it is advised to consider to pay for the internal transport (electric golf carts) as the distances are rather big ( 140 hectares). The park also houses some restaurants and shops. If you really want to visit all art works and galeries you might consider visit the park for two days, and buy a special ticket for that (cheaper than buying two day-tickets)

Perhaps the most incredible things I have ever seen anywhere in the world.
A must see for anyone that appreciates art, architecture, landscaping and beauty in general.
An absolute cultural patrimony to all of mankind.

titulo: Very beautiful park / modern museum - free entrance every Wednesday
conteudo:
Came here with my friends and 4 children. this park is huge so that you should spend at least 1/2 day if not the whole. Its 1,5h drive from BH but we got stuck in traffic on the way back so that it took us 2,5h to return home.
for those who are too lazy to walk or simply who want to speed up their visit there are golf cars for rent availble for 28 Reas pp.
we didnt have much time since we arrived too late so that we just enjoyed the walk in this beautiful park.

I’m not a fan of contemporary art. But these place is something unbelievable. Some fantastic works in an amazing place, where nature is respected.
My suggestion is to visit it on a Tuesday. Almost empty so you can enjoy it without cues.
Take a day with nice weather, you kids and go to Inhotim. Exuberant nature, art and a lot of fun. We had very funny moments on the Helio Oiticica space!

titulo: Nice place for the day visit
conteudo: Very nice park. I do understand nothing in the modern art, but it is intersting to see anyway. But the most attarctive thing is the park itself. We spent the day there. Not recommended if the weather is hot.
Book two days to visit this museum. Everything works great. You feel like not being in Brazil. The views are astonishing. All ages must love to visit this place.

This is my second visit as the first time I had planned only a day and it was not long enough!!!
Get there for 09:30 when it opens to avoid the ridiculous queues if you arrive later, 2 days minimum to see everything at a leisurely pace
Eat earlier or later and try to avoid the big restaurants - on the orange route there are unmarked food vans and cafes - the waiting for food is typically Brasilian inefficiency which lends some aggravation to an otherwise idyllic place!
My fave was G20 but it is all beautiful, tranquil and relaxing! GO DO NOT MISS IT!!!

Inhotim is worth for its garden. They are beautiful. The place is very nicely kept and there are two good restaurants on the grounds. The visit at Inhotim requires good shoes because one walks a lot. It takes at list two days to see the whole place.

titulo: I am not an art guy so not fair to write
conteudo: If you are ant art person it will likely blow your mind, we aren;t, so was fine but our loving friends were very impressed.

This park is absolutely stunning, the combination of nature & modern art is fantastic! I recommend planning a full day & getting the golf cart pass, there is simply so much to see & discover! For art fanatics, I would even say it's worth to travel to Belo Horizonte just to see this!

titulo: A must go of Belo Horizonte
conteudo: It is an open air museum full of galeries within an idyllic gardens. You are going to need more than 1 day to cover it all. nice restaurants in the Museum and woderful facilities.

Weekend visit at the park. We participated at Iron Run. You can rent a golf car to ride across the park because it's very big and it takes at least a couple of days to see it all.
The main restaurant is fancy and has a nice atmosphere. All the installations' buildings are wonderful and the natural environment is breathtaking. The only problem is that it's located in the middle of nowhere and there's nothing to do in the city other than the park.

I'm really very proud of having so nice museum in Minas Gerais. The area is so big and it's impossible to visit everything walking in just one day. There is an option to buy a ticket including the transportation cars to move inside. The galleries are amazing, the nature is spectacular and the facilities are comfortable and well maintained. It's mandatory to visit this unique jewelry in Brazil.

Inhotim is a unique blend of modern art, architecture and botanical garden that is incredibly beautiful and engaging. We spent two full days there and did not have the time to see everything. The gardens are a beautiful place to be. The architecture had some stunning buildings and most of the art work is simply too large to be displayed anywhere else. There were emotionally engaging art pavilions, pavilions that were playful, and some that highlighted the nature around them. If you have a few days it is worth making your way to Brumadinho to see this site.

titulo: An art museum unlike any other
conteudo:
We have visited many art museums around the world, but have never seen anything like Inhotim. Numerous buildings featuring different contemporary artists dot the grounds, amid a luxuriant landscape. It’s hard to decide what we liked better, the gardens or the galleries and exhibits. This was our second two-day visit, since our prior visit had simply not been enough to absorb everything.

Some galleries are quite some distance away, but the walks among the gardens are a pleasure in themselves. For those not so keen on walking, the museum offers ground transportation around the site.

Inhotim has also done a remarkable job integrating the local community. Nearly all staff lives in the next town (Brumadinho), which would not provide good employment opportunities otherwise. When asked, gallery staff can provide accurate information about the exhibits.

Rereading the review I posted here nearly three years ago, I felt I had been a bit harsh on Inhotim and its access, in particular. We went back recently and had a better experience, I must admit.

Access is still less than ideal. This time around, Google maps showed us a route that was shorter (by way of São Joaquim de Bicas), but which had the last few miles on a dirt road, used by local mining concerns. Not ideal but better than a zillion speed bumps.

Other than the access, everything was great this time around. Although we went on a weekend, Inhotim was not packed and we managed to see everything we wanted.

The restaurants had no waiting lines and the food was decent. In that regard, they have two large restaurants that are always open and some other facilities that are available according to demand. One of these restaurants is an all-you-can eat buffet and the other serves food by weight. The first is more upscale, with nice table linen and a wide variety of cold and hot dishes, including lamb and salmon the day we went. The second is larger, more affordable, and offers fewer dishes, basic beef, pork, and chicken, among other hot specialties. But note that both restaurants are served by the same kitchen, so there is no difference in terms of quality.

Would we go back to Inhotim a third time? Definitely.

We were amazed by the green areas and all the exposition. Some art will impress you more or less but getting around the place is already an enjoyment.

You need at least a full day to get around the whole park. I would highly recommend the golf carts rides if you've only got a day there otherwise, get your athletic shoes on and a carry a bottle of water with you at all times!

Inhotim is unique since it combines a botanical garden with a modern art museum. We visited it in a whole day (arriving at opening to avoid lines) and leaving almost at close time. We had lunch at Oiticica restaurante, but you can also bring your own food. They have water fountains over the area, which is quite handful (you don't have to carry lots of water bottles with you).

If you are visiting it for 1 day only, it's fundamental to get the pass to use the electric cars to move around. If you are a huge modern art fan, you will probably want to spend 2 days or more, but for us 1 was perfect.

The integration between the gardens and the art pieces is amazing. They have several interesting galleries from multiple artists, make sure to make some research before you go to optimize your visit. They have some open, free guided tours offered; we took the Thematic one, but it was just ok.

So, highly recommend visiting Inhotim!

I am art lover therefore I am not objective!

The park it is the best attraction I had done in 🇧🇷 It show real símbolos of the country such as: Art - Architecture - Green Design and even food

It deserve a day or two

If you go enjoy it using the golf cart, don't save the money there. It make the difference 28 reais per person

Wednesday is free entrence

You can chattel from holiday inn savassi Wednesday and weekends

this is a unique park combining art galeries in a tropical park. most of the times the nature is art itself.
If you are in belo Horizonte, take a day and visit Inhotim.
It worth to pay a bit extra and be able to use the automotive transfer, than walk if you have only one day. Do go early in the morning and confirm the time they close and the time the trasnfer is stopped. Eat in the more expensive restaurant, it is so much better. visit the most distant garelies first, let the nearby ones for late afternoon.

undoubtedly one of the greatest museums in the whole world. Not far from Belo Horizonte - a 2 hours drive - we can experience contemporary art in perfect harmony with nature. There is a suttle bus (Saritur, it's possible to buy the tickets online) that departures everyday from the Belo Horizonte main bus station to Inhotim's parking lot. Round trip is around 65 reais and the service is good. In inhotim I'd recommend paying some more and buying the ticket that allows you to use the eletric cars due to the fact that the place is huge!

titulo: A must go once a year
conteudo:
A farm turned into an open air contemporary art museum. Amazing gardens all around.
Incredible collection Interactive spaces. Suits children, elders.

At entrance, don´t forget the pass to use the electric carts, despite of walking tour be the best way, the area is huge. Some sculptures are quite far from the others, so, you need to use the carts. It´s needed more than one day if you plan to know all the park and galleries. Appreciate the wonderful gardens, artworks, or sit at a bench and read a book... Do what you want surrounded by astonishing nature.
Inhotim has great gardens and contemporary art. You do not need to be an art expert to enjoy it all!! Plan more than one day of visit to fully enjoy the Inhotim experience.
This is a must know for any traveler in the world... is unique and has nothing to do with anything seen before.
Astonishing collection of art in a even more beautiful park. Need 2-3 days to fully appreciate all attractions.

Incredible place. Very well organized. Clean. Great attractions (not every attraction is a great attraction, but the ones that are great pay the visit).
You can spend two full days over there to enjoy the whole place. It really worth it!

Do your research online before going....definitely get your ticket with the golf cart ride....distances are too big between exhibits you will gain time. Not a good place if you have physical disabilities. A full day will give you a good idea of the place and you can see quite a bit. Outside gardens are worth visiting specially the desert one. Do not miss the Tunga exhibit. Start with the orange line and have lunch and than do the pink line. Ask the drivers of the golf cart what to see at each stop to make sure you do not miss anything...enjoy and extraordinary journey!

titulo: Never thought I'g like contemporary art!
conteudo:
Contemporary art exhibition in vast tropical garden (400ha) , 26 exhibition halls. All sort of art from photos to interactive. Take 2 days to visit, sleep in Brumadinho, if you're not very good at walking, choose the cart with a guide, it's well worth it.
The restaurants in the place are very good.

Inhotim is a botanical garden with arts in the gardens and with art galleries as well. It takes two days to visit it completely, using the golf cars that cross some routes inside the park. There are two swim pools, one is open-aired and the other is covered. They are considered arts, but it is possible to swim on it. There are two restaurants inside. Wearing confort shoes is a must. There are free tap water dispensers around the park, as well as restrooms. I reccomend to pay for the golf cars and avoid the summer season.

We had a perfect day at Inhotim, walking through the botanical garden and wachting the various exhibitions from many different national and international artists.
It's an unique experience that we recommend for everybody.

This is my second time in Inhotim. In this place you find not only fenomenal and wonderful landscapes but incredible art exhibitions. This is a magical place. Let your senses get lost in this paradise.

World Artists have their work here and naturally the best of the best from Brasil. Congratulations to the people of Inhotim for their friendliness and for keeping this place like a post card.

All around Inhotim is love and quality.

Visiting the place with a guide is highly recommended.

It really is outstanding. The mining magnate who put this place together, or at least financed it, had a grand vision. I haven't seen anything like it in the world. The scale is staggering. A vast horticultural marvel (park) interspersed with often dedicated galleries for a wide variety of local and international contemporary artists, from Tunga to Mathew Barney. Some of the art works are made especially for the place. Good restaurants, impeccable facilities and staff to boot. Just try to avoid the peak periods as attendance can vary between less than a thousand a day to a whopping ten thousand. A unique visit that puts the south of Belo Horizonte on the map.

We have seen many artistic places, but this one is in a league of its own.
20-odd art galleries in a jungle of thousands of palm trees of all sorts.
Art is mainly contemporary Brazilian, of a very high level.
For a good visit, you should stay 2 days, because the place is really wide.
It is also a good place to have a bite (apparently there are 10 restaurants/cafés, of all prices. We ate at restaurant Oiticica which is an architectural pearl and offers food reasonably priced (per-kilo restaurant).
Wednesday has free entrance.
Don't miss it.

titulo: One of the hidden gems of Brazil.
conteudo:
This art park might be far from the popular tourist destinations of Brazil, but it's definitely one of the places you should not miss. Awesome art installations and exhibition halls, and a beautiful park to explore.
There are a lot of installations where you can actually interact with art. A pro tip: bring a swimsuit, so you can swim in an outdoor and also an indoor pool in a really fantastic and peculiar setting.
If you happen to travel to Belo Horizonte (or anywhere in Minas Gerais) do come here and spend at least half a day! (a full day is recommended)

The largest open air museum in the world. Inhotim is a unique experience, an art form to be lived, felt and touched!
I was enchanted by a museum so alive, unlike anything, I've ever seen in the world.

Arts and botanica together divide spaces.

One day is little for the visit.

Developed by mining billionaire Bernardo Paz, Inhotim is more than anything I could have ever expected... especially in a Brazilian country side.

Inhotim is beyond lush and colourful! Around every corner is the tallest strongest tree and the brightest flowers you've ever seen! The grounds are perfectly manicured. The up keep must be constant! I even wondered into the botanical nursery which had massive screened in lodges of budding new plants. This garden is huge! Marked walking trails and designated go-cart roads lead you to all the permanent art installations.

Cannot rave enough about the incredible artwork! Real art. Thought provoking and original! FUN FACT: every building is created in collaboration between an architect and the artist whose art will be showcased there. You can feel this harmony between art and architecture - each angle and lightbulb is purposeful.

I took two full days to view the park which was just enough to see all the installations. Had i not started from opening to close I wouldn't have seen everything. Would definitely recommend to do one full day walking (in main yellow trail) and then get a go cart pass for the next day (for two purple and orange trails).

Favourites: TUNGA and Doug Aitken installations - really all were amazing. And I wish I could've had more time to sit and reflect at each one.

Had buffet style lunches at Restaurante Oiticica and Bar don Ganso. I loved the retro 60s modern style of Bar don Ganso and the open chic style of Oiticica.

If you love art and if you love being outdoors Inhotim is peaceful, introspective, stunning and impressive!

I read plans that they're expanding to build a hotel and more instalments - I'll definitely be back!
