Its a huge place with too much art for one day. you need at least 3-4 days to see everything and enjoy the nature and all the art. Really beautiful. If you go there, dont go with your own car because you will be tired after. Take a bus or stay near in a hotal for a few days. Its a must see if you are in BH or around.

If you have time, spend two days here. It's one of the most beautiful open art galleries in the world, set in amazingly beautiful surroundings. Compares to the equally brilliant Naoshima Island in Japan. By the way stay close in Brumaldinho and if you are getting the bus from Rio to Belo Horizonte you will miss the connecting bus to Brumaldinho so you can get an Uber instead. The times of the buses don't quite match, so beware.

titulo: Our son and his wife had been here before and said it was a must-see. They were right! We loved it.
conteudo: This place is a unique combination of art and nature. The park, the galleries, and the artwork in them combine in a truly jaw-dropping experience. This place should be on everyone's bucket list! We spent 2 long days exploring, pondering, and being totally amazed at the natural beauty. We could have easily spent a week here.

How come this is not in the Eyewitness Guide to Brazil from 2012? It's the best kept of secrets. This is a paradise for lovers of contemporary art and/or sub-tropical gardens. Check out the website. It's true that it's well off the beaten track- you fly in to Belo Horizonte and then face hiring a car (Hertz was very inefficient, officious and slow here!) and a drive of 90-120 minutes on very busy, slow roads, shared with many trucks. we stayed nearby at Hotel Villa de Montagne in Brumadinho. Inhotim is rumoured to be adding hotels soon. But the place is a type of wonderland! Get there if you can. We spent a full day, arriving when the Park opened at 9.30am and staying till closing time at 4.30pm. Others take 2 days, which is certainly easier but it can be done in 1 if you are energetic and fit. you don't need a guide- the map and signs cover enough- and there are free guided tours twice daily. On Wednesdays entry is free too currently.

titulo: Excellent mix of modern art, landscaping and nature
conteudo:
To see all the art galleries and the main part of the park you definitely need 2 full days. It’s recommendable to buy a 2 day passport via internet in advance. You can get it with a small discount and you can collect it at the reception of the park. You have to go to the booth saying `friends of Inhotim´.
To really experience the park and the installations you should go walking instead of using the ´shared golf cars´. It makes you more part of the experience. Good walking shoes are needed though, because of the distances and sometimes you walk small stretches through the forest. As an added bonus we saw a lot of butterflies and a group of monkeys when doing so.
Further tips: If you are flexible to choose when to go you could go during the month of January. A lot of people are at the beach or outside the country, which gives you more space and privacy during your visit. It is also recommended to stay at a small hotel or ´pousada´ in Brumadinho (the village next to the park). Although it is a very small and quiet place, it is very convenient when going for the 2 day passport and saves you an hour’s drive to BH.
The artworks themselves are of high quality. There is a great diversity in paintings, installations and sculptures. Also note that most of the galleries are very beautifully designed and integrated in the environment. This is the only item where we see room for improvement: it would be very nice if each gallery would have a sign stating the architect and constructor. Besides this minor issue: a must see!

titulo: It's all you can hope for - and more
conteudo: I used to think Inhotim was just a nice open-air museum. But what made the greatest impact on me was the amazing, top of the art landscaping. This is a place where you can go many times and still be surprised. You'll need two days to visit. Go to the central ones on the first day, and buy an internal transportation ticket for the second day to visit the ones that are farther out. Try to have lunch in two different restaurants, as all of them are very different and very good!

titulo: A Dream Garden of Art - Inhotim
conteudo: I learned about his magical place through my own artsy internet investigations. Having family in the state of Alagoas, Brasil that I visit every 2-3 years, I vowed to find a way to visit Inhotim. I was suprised to learn that many Brasilians have not even heard of Inhotim. So, I took my daughter (a Brasilian resident) and flew from Maceio to Belo Horizonte, drove to Brumadinho (where we stayed) and spent 2 full days at Inhotim. Inhotim is about 15 minutes drive from the delightful city of Brumadinho. Inhotim is a friendly, HUGE tropical landscape of rolling hills, electric blue butterflies, gardens and of course, ART. Inhotim is ripe with installations of both historically important and playful art which is always been added to.. The Architectural installations are given ample land and space and create post card scenes that take your breath away. It seems to never end. I could have spend 4 or 5 days exploring. Inhotim also hosts a centre for heritage and contributes to school programs. Wednesdays are free (but busy). Excellent considerations are made for persons with disabilities and facilities and food are easily available. Some food options were pricey, but we chose to go for it on one day and had a wonderful buffet at Tamboril. Inhotim is well maintained by hundreds of devoted curators, cart drivers, landscapers, cooks, and clerks. Many speak some English, but I recommend you learn a little Portuguese to be able to communicate with the staff. Most exhibits welcome photography and all communications and signs are in both Portuguese and English. Enough of my meandering text..Just go there!!
There is not just an art exhibition park. It`s also not just a fascinating park. Inhotim is all this and much more. It`s a unique place!!

What a place... can't say in words or pictures, you must go there and see it. Usually is very crowd on weekends and holidays, we were lucky because it was raining s lot in Belo Horizonte but not in Inhotim, so the place was almost empty. Ask for the golf cart when you by your ticket it is worth. Specially it you have only one day.

I had been told that it was worth making the trip from Belo Horizonte to Inhotim but I had no idea it was going to be quite so spectacular.

I shared an Uber with two people from my hostel. Total cost 105R each way. Time taken 1:15 each way.

Set in 500,000 acres of picture postcard countryside are 23 galleries, each dedicated to a single artist's work, a further 23 open air sculptures/artworks, 5 botanical gardens and 2 lakes all beautifully laid out. Luckily there are golf buggies to ferry those who elect to pay (that'll be me) to the further reaches of the park. One extreme has Doug Aitken and Matthew Barney galleries, another has Chris Burden's enormous Beam Drop sculpture and a third has a vast pavillion housing Brasilian Psicoativa Tunga's works. Every path leads to a gallery or artwork, the most magical ones hidden in the woods or by water. Almost all the artists were unknown to me so I enjoyed discovering them.

The park and the art therein is owned by former mining magnate Bernardo Paz who, in just 10 years has brought together art and nature to take your breath away. And it's constantly evolving, a new gallery having recently opened and more planned. I would love to go back in a few years to revisit the old works and discover the new ones.

I actually booked a private guide (Mathias) the previous day (by email), for the first 2.5 hours of my visit. He was very informative and helped put everything into context for me. The only down side was that, having paid 250R, I still had to wait in the queue for the most popular galleries. I asked Mathias to check with customer services who were not in the least bit interested, saying I had to wait in line like everyone else.

Luckily waiting time added up to no more than 20 minutes but it could easily have been longer. At 100R an hour I don't think this is acceptable.

Apart from that, it was an amazing visual experience. Make the effort to go - you won't regret it.

titulo: If your not into Art it's probably not for you either
conteudo:
Coming from the UK and Europe, I've been accustomed to museums and galleries in Italy, France, England etc with famous pieces from around the world. Actual art.

I'm not an Artsy person, I appreciate a skilled painting or creation but I'm not a believer of a bottle of Coca Cola on the floor with the lid off being a work of art... There were many of these items here.

Some of the works included:

An upside down tree on a frame.

Numerous projectors with random images.

A room with some balloons.

A black room with some hammocks to sit in.

A room with 5 mattresses?

A room of currency from a couple of countries framed...

The only reason we went into most of the many galleries is to escape the sun!

Some of the art looked like they had run out of money and just put a cardboard shape in a case and said it was a feature.

With this said, the grounds were beautiful and very well maintained. We wales around 11k in the day (very hot day), so take the $25BR caddy rides.

There is no food available around the park until mid day so make sure you have some before you enter.

All in all

titulo: A must see contemporary art  collection within a bespoke botanical garden and architectural setting
conteudo: Everything is PERFECT. The art collection, the bespoke designed galleries for each piece or artists, the landscape all perfectly orchestrated. The service on the phone and on site are also brilliant despite the volumes of guests they welcome every day, the Brazilain's service with a smile and absolute client service orientated staff. Both restauarants offer great food, as all ingredients are first class. I recommend for sure a guided tour with an art historian (one can contact the local university) and also a private golf car - specially if visiting on a weekend.

titulo: Best museum I've ever been to
conteudo: Inhotim museum was amazing! It's an open air museum, so it involves quite a lot of walking as the total area is 140 hectares (options for driving transport too, however they cost money). It's amazing though. Not only is it a natural beauty, but while you're walking through the park, you will find art galleries! My favourites were G16, Galeria Miguel Rio Branco, and gallery G23, Galeria Claudia Andujar, would recommend both if you like photography. Many people had recommended this museum to my during my travels in Brazil and I'm so glad I went, it was simply brilliant.

A huge open air museum just outside Belo Horizonte. It used to be a fazenda that was transformed to house the collection of Mr Bernardo Paz. It is a mix of pavilions, work of art i the open and botanical specimens from around the world. The tickets are very accessible and the organization and transport around the ground is perfect. You do not need to appreciate modern art to visit. You cannot bring food but the are restaurants and cafes inside. The are 2 work of art that are pools (one interior and one exterior) that you can use. So id it is hot you can have a dip. Some of the exhibition pavilions are also architectural sights. The gardens/forest are also very agreeable for strolls. I spent a weekend there but 3 days is also fine if you want to take your time to see more audiovisual exhibitions

Wonderful Museum with its breathtaking gardens and huge Art Galleries! Peace and relax! Good restaurants, especially the Tamboril one. The Coffee shop close to the shop of plants and ceramics is really something. The homemade pão de queijo is a must taste!
Amazing Art Trip while in Belo Horizonte, the park is modern and vast, it will take your breath away. It's surrounded by beautiful landscape, an unforgettable memory awaits you.
One of the best museum experience I had. You see, listen, smell and interact. The park is also beautiful!!

titulo: art, nature, and a whole pack of tourists
conteudo: It was a great place to leisurely stroll and enjoy nature and contemporary art. Loved how they organized the nature part and also appreciated the contemporary art that they have got. However, I think it was so popular with the locals and there were really ALOT of people when we got there. English translations were at the minimum so the place was a little bit hard to understand. Overall though it was a good experience.

One of the largest botanical garden in the world, very well maintained, galleries with contemporary artwork and outdoor exposed sculptures of famous artists from various countries. A paradise to be visited before dying.

We spent the whole day in the park which is a mixture of botanical garden and art gallery. It is very interesting to see how the art installations are part of the nature. Loved it and would have come back if my 3-years old son was not soooo tired.

titulo: Visiting here was the reason for my trip to Brazil and I’d go back tomorrow.
conteudo: You cannot prepare for the magnitude of this most extraordinary sculpture park and botanical garden. Walking to and around the art and pavilions through the garden is a far more integral part of the experience than I had understood before I went. It is, simply, unbelievable. TIP: book tickets online so you don’t have to stand on line when you get there. And make a reservation for lunch at Tamboril Restaurant –the buffet lunch option is EXCELLENT. We were there for 2 days in a row and ate there both days, and it was not repetitive. Final tip: DO NOT RUSH – you’re going this far, give yourself 2 full days in the park. And if at all possible, walk the whole thing, don’t take the golf cart. If you’re a sculpture fan and have been to Storm King, or the Chinati Foundation, or Dia: Beacon -- this is something else entirely.

This is a wild and wonderful way to enjoy art and plants for a few days. The restaurants are excellent. With swimming and hiking, there's enough to keep you mesmerized for at least two days. The on site hotel wasn't finished, so part of the fun is figuring out where to stay and how to get to the museum.

It's a place to appreciate contemporary art and nature. It's surrounded by gorgeous garden. They have a very good infrastructure (if you don't like or can't a walk a lot, they have a car service circulating throughout the park - R$ 25,00 per person per day). They have good restaurants (one is more expensive, Tamboril - R$ 70,00/person, a self service buffet you can eat as much as you want and the dessert is included and the other Oiticica - R$ 22,00/person, self service but can only serve your self one time and the dessert is not included). Two days is enough.
Inhotim is one of the most beautiful place I have ever visit! For the ones who like nature and art, this is the place you need to visit!

titulo: A must if you're in Minas Gerais!
conteudo: A perfect mix of nature and art, amazing really, never went anywhere like it! A very big complex, can be done quickly in a day, but deserves more. I went alone, but I wish I could have went with my non-museum lover friends, I'm sure they would love it

I've liked this place for the peacefull atmosphere that it can offer and the wonderfull walk. Each part or the park is well preserved and the visitor can access easilly to all the information required to visit (maps, indications, informations..)

Speechless. After hours walking, seeing, arts, you wish you could go back and do it all over again. Definitely going back. My children loved it. The pools, the park, the fish.
One must go

titulo: The most amazing place I 've ever been in my entire life.
conteudo:
The forbidden city, Versailles, Alhambra and so many else are also amazing, beautiful and full of history but they were all built by powerful sovereign who had the power to force their people building them. Inhotim is not only a private initiative but also unique in its concept, a kind of MomA put in a huge botanic garden as large as 10 or even 20 times Rio's ou capetown's ones.
A must see if you go to Brazil or you live there.

Exploring the gardens and exhibitions was a pleasure. A great tip is to visit Inhotim's website before going there. It is worth paying to take the electric carts that shuttle visitors around the huge area. I would reccomend it to anyone with an interest in gardens and contemporary art.

The Instituto Inhotim, dedicated to contemporary art, is one of those must-see places. It is an old farmhouse, immense, nowadays, a botanic garden. The organization of the institute is outstanding, from the signage, services and information offered. As the place is huge (difficult to be visited in one day), you can use an internal transport service (hop in hop off). There are several places to eat and drink, including two restaurants (Tamboril and Oiticica). The works of art are located throughout the park, and there are dozens of galleries, each of then dedicated exclusively to the work of only one artist. The galleries, incidentally, are different from each other and are themselves, works worthy of being seen. Returning after a few years, I realized that there are some maintenance issues, as in some galleries and services (restrooms). There is a shop with many products alluding to the park. It really is a must-see place. It is located in the town of Brumadinho, distant about 60 km from Belo Horizonte. You can go by taxi or Uber (about $ 50 each way) or travel agencies vans. There is the possibility of staying in the region (there are some hotels nearby). Note that it is closed in Mondays.

titulo: Outstanding Outdoor Art Gallery in a Botanical Garden
conteudo: This huge contemporary art exhibition in about 25 buildings amidst a vast botanical garden is a feast for the senses! World-famous artists contribute to the exhibitions and it takes at least two days to see everything. We only had one day and saw as much as we could in 6 hours, including lunch. One can walk to different sections or buy an advance ticket for the small jitneys to transport you. It is a must-see if you are in Minas Gerais.
GREAT! Just pack and go and spend a whole day there! Vale a distância, vale a visita! Melhor do que eu esperava.

Reserve the whole day for this visit, if possible, more than one day. It's a huge park, ever changing and increasing. The guides are great in talking about the art works. Getting here from Belo Horizonte is easy, the tourism department of the state does good job in this aspect.

The Inhotim park is one of the most interesting places I`ve ever been. A huge outdoors contemporary art gallery. It takes two days to visit all the attractions. There are three main routes (yellow, pink and orange). Pick one and enjoy the beauty all over!!

Definetly a special place where nature and art get together, really liked the views, the tree trunk carved seats and beautiful lakes. Went there on a Tuesday, I took the Saritour bus from Rodoviaria in Belo Horizonte, the only daily bus leaves the station at 8:15 am and returns at 4:30 pm from Inhotim, its the only bus so make sure you are there on time. I chose the internal transportation in Inhotim and it was worth it because the place is so big that you need the transportation if you want to see it in a day. Would have liked they had more open snack places or automated machines so that we could buy water and something to snack on, so my recommendation is that you take some beforehand or buy when you arrive at the reception because every other stand I saw was closed. Really liked it definetly worth the trip.

I've just gone to inhotim because i have a convention in belo horizonte, i hired a private transfer withhappy travel with a guide who drove us in a private car directly from the airport, 1:30h distance from belo horizonte, we didn't wait in a line, our guide drove us directly inside the park, the place is huge, they say you need 2 days to visit but we had a couple of hours, anyway when you arrive you get impacted with the huge vegetation, plants extremely rare, everything well mantained and clean, and in the middle of this outstanding nature many art galleries with contemporaneous art, breathless with the beauty, there are small cars to go to some places but most of the you walk, if you have walking disabilities this is not a place to visit, an experience you can't miss, pity not very well known

This is a opened museum! There are many different experiences into this place! Atractions for many and stiles and mainstream! A pretty nice atraction is the truerouge, the history, the emotional impact of this art is different! You should visit! But, for me, the best one is the cosmococa atraction, in that place, the inventores, the artist try to put in you who the cocaine change our perception! The pool is very nice!

Expensive to go with taxi, however is the best choise. Opened at 9:00 am and closed at 4:30 pm. You have to buy doble ticket with transport added, because the atractions are so far from each other. Go with credit card and money, a bottle with fresh water and some snacks. There are three large routs to know. Enjoy !

Very surprising place mixing south american modern art (21 galeries) and beautiful garden! Really worth a trip to Brumadinho! Recommend at least a full day and you take the extra internal transportation (internal routes) to move around as it is huge! Recommend Galeria cosmococa G15 and Marila Dardot G17 with Kids! Sleeping at Betim could be a good option as it is 50 minutes drive (30km) from Inhotim and the hotels are more affordable than Brumadinho's. The ABBA Hotel at Betim is a good option.

This place is absolutely magical . I took my 87 year old grandma, my 4 year old daughter and three teenage cousins there : all of us simply loved it ! They have discounted entrance for students and seniors , they are extremely considered of people w limited mobility and everybody was very helpful and attentive . The grounds are kept immaculate , it's very big so if you have the time spend at least two days there, the large art installations are magnificent but you also wanna spend time just looking around: birds ,little monkeys , the mountains behind ! They have three restaurants w different price range . The food was very good (homemade Brazilian food). I can't say enough how amazing this place is . A true first world class attraction .

titulo: A marvelous garden full of art- a must see!
conteudo: Inhotim is a magnificent opean air art gallery in a setting full of orchids, lakes, tropical plants and the like. I was surprised we had

titulo: An absolute must if you visit Brasil
conteudo: I know, Brumadinho is in the middle of nowhere. And first you have to fly to Belo Horizonte. But Inhotim is one of the most refined things I have seen in Brasil or even the world. It is absolutely amazing. We visited Inhotim while travelling from Belo Horizonte to Ouro Preto and we really regretted not being able to cut our trip to Ouro Preto short to have more time for Inhotim. Even our kids who are 6 and 8 old loved it. In one day you can see and absorb a lot but you need two to four to have time to see everything. It is a complete mistery to me why nobody promotes Inhotim in Brasil or Europe.

This is more than a museum, I have no words to describe it! I am brazilian and I have no idea that such place could be possible. It is a open museum, and the garden and the landscapes are fantastic! It is located in a very small town, wiht nothing else to do, so when you come here choose a good hotel that the typical culinary of the state, that is very delicious!

titulo: The largest collection of outdoor art galleries in the world!
conteudo:
This place is amazing, even if you're not the sort of person to visit art galleries. If you can imagine about 20 or 30 Serpentine Galleries randomly scattered through a twice-the-size-Kew-Gardens, in the tropics, you'll sort of get an idea of the place!
Some of the artists featured in the galleries were not my thing at all but it didn't matter, you just passed quickly through and out into the sunshine again! Or you enjoyed the architecture of the gallery itself. Then there were the grounds ~ beautifully landscaped, a work of art themselves. A wide selection of food in different restaurants and cafes. There is one day a week when it's free entry too....Monday I think, but check. We went back for a 2nd day and managed to just about squeeze it all in, but a 3rd day would have made it all a bit more leisurely. Worth making the effort to get there, but go soon because we heard that due to the economic problems Brasil is going through, there were cuts on the way and staff had been dismissed.

If you like the concept great contemporary art + wandering in a luxuriant nature, prepare to stay at least 2 days if you want to visit the all park.
If you want to quietly enjoy all of this, come during the week or very early during the week-end.
And don't forget to wear very comfortable walking shoes!

Impossible to express the wonderment of this place — both an amazing park, with extraordinary gardens, and dazzling art galleries. My husband and I spent two days there. Some would say that wasn't enough, but for us it was just right. On the first day we tried to do several areas on foot, but I quickly gave out. The electric cars that the park offers for transportation are more than worth the reasonable price. We plan to return, and we will be telling everyone we know to make the trip!

Despite a while ago since I went to the contemporary art museum/park, I'd still like to write a review for Inhotim. It was such a delightful day strolling inside the park with numerous corners and moments for you to explore and discover. The collection is beyond my expectation. I mean, I've lived in Paris for a year (and thus seeing many art exhibitions) and have just been to Tate Modern lately, Inhotim remains one of the most impressive exhibitions (certainly top few among what I've seen in the past year). I am very surprised about the quantity and the standard of work that is presented in the park. Chris Burden's Beam Drop itself is a powerful art piece, Candle city on fire by Dyamamoto is eerie and provocative. Olafur Eliasson never disappoints you. And one biggest surprise is to find Yayoi Kusama's work here (narcissistic garden). While art is bountiful, the park itself is a pleasant experience - with well-thought landscape design (Brazilian landscape architect Burle Marx did involve in the project). I went there initially for architecture (one special thing about the park is some building is designed for a particular artist/artwork) but the park offered me way more.

Staff is professional and welcoming and the park is very very clean and well-maintained.
I definitely recommend everybody (Art/architecture/nature lover) to pay a visit there. Belo Horizonte isn't too interesting a city but it definitely worths a short stay for Inhotim.

Technical info:
free on Wednesday. suggest taking the carts in order to cover more areas without rush (not expensive anyway). bus from and back city centre at 8 or 9am (can't remember exactly) and 4.30pm respectively. food is decent and inexpensive in the park so don't worry about starving in the wild.

titulo: Beautiful Place, Art from Worthwhile to What the (you know what)
conteudo:
Inhotim is truly beautiful, not just the place itself, but the surrounding hills in Minas Gerais. Scrupulously maintained to blend in with nature. You travel from one art exhibit to the next along paths up and down the hills. The distances are too large for walking, at least to cover all exhibits in one day, so make sure to buy access to the traveling carts. There are many, so waiting times are not much, and even with the carts you will do a fair amount of walking.

Being there all day, you will need to eat. Inhotim offers two restaurants, one somewhat expensive, Tamboril, but we found the extensive offering of self-serve food to be tasty and the setting relaxing. Another restaurant, nearby on the lake also offers an enjoyable setting and is considerably less expensive, with a selection of several prepared meals.

The architecture of the various exhibit buildings is striking. The only reason for an overall rating for Inhotim of Very Good instead of Excellent is that the quality of the art, at least from my perspective, varies much. Of course this kind of evaluation is hugely subjective, but other people viewing some of the exhibits seemed to agree. My favorite spontaneous comment from others regarding some paintings of trees, of which an entire building was built to display about 5 or so of these paintings, was, The painter must have painted these when he was two years old. Ok, I get that art is meant to communicate on many levels, and abstractly. But there are so many Brazilian artists that can communicate more effectively with many more people. My opinion is that even more people would be drawn to Inhotim if more of the exhibits had a more general appeal.

That being said, still a worthwhile visit. Images from the Yanomami exhibition will be with me for a long time, as was the experience of listening directly to the sounds of the earth. Plan for an entire day. Wednesday is free, and Tuesday and Thursday is considerably cheaper than the weekends. Our Thursday visit was calm and without crowds.

We were told to visit a museum for a whole day, but did not know that it actually is a conglomerate of many galleries situated in a beautifully landscaped tropical garden.
Some of the buildings itself are worth visiting, like the Galeria Claudia Andujar.
We spent a whole day, but managed to see only half the exhibitions.We even used the golf carts to take us around, but still did not make it to see it all.
There are 2 restaurants, one with more Brazilian dishes for 23 Rials per person, the more international one for 66 Rials per person.

titulo: Art lovers you should go. Few tips below
conteudo:
We went there with our two teenage girls and we truly enjoyed the day.
Few suggestions: book your tickets through Internet and you will save some time at the entrance; if youre not on a tight budget book for the private tour that will save you time and walk.
Bring your swimming costumes: there are some installations in which you can take a bath!!!
And take the ticket with the shuttle which is very fast and reliable and it avoids you long walks in hot weather. It is absolutely worth the additional cost.
Plan to spend a full day if you like contemporary art.
Excellent museum.

We had an amazing time and the only problem was that there was just too much to see. Two days would have been ideal. The collection is fantastic and the gardens are beautiful. Worth the drive from Belo Horizonte (about 90 minutes).

Walking along the paths in the botanical garden was a refreshing experience. The old trees, the palm trees old and just planted, the orchid green house, everything invites you to contemplation and relax. Don't miss it

titulo: Don't miss The opportunity to go to Inhotim
conteudo:
Most beautiful contemporary art Musuem in the world! It is also one of the largest botanical gardens in South America. I have been to Inhotim many times and am always happy to return and see what's new at the museum.
They also have two excellent restaurants that I strongly advise to have lunch at, you will not regret it!!! Do not miss out on the desserts at Tamboril Restaurant.
Try to avoid going on important Brazilian holidays because it gets very crowded.

titulo: An Tourist Oasis in the hills and mountains surrounding Belo Horizonte
conteudo: My Brazilian partner had for a week told me of our visit to this as she explained mixture of Modern Art and Botanical Gardens. She underestimated Inhotim, a formerly a mine and surrounding property which has been transformed to one of the best tourist parks / gardens I have visited. In amongst the calm and beauty of these gardens are many galleries which display the modern art of the recent times. Truley an experience worth a day or even two days visit. Reasonable prices for Bus trip from Belo Horizonte and entrance to the Gardens. I am not young enough to understand each of the artist's intent, but great evperience.

titulo: Um dos melhores museus a céu aberto do mundo
conteudo: Inhotim is located 60km from Belo Horizonte and its one of the most incredible places I've been visited in my life. The gardens are perfetcly organized and gorgeous. It's a place where you really feel in contact with the nature and know a little bit more about arts even if you don't like it. The galleries are amazing especially those with music. If you come to Minas Gerais and you don't know Inhotim, sorry but you did not come to Minas Gerais.

It was really nice to spend the day in Inhotim. Some people say one is not enough but we could see everything as we arrived a few minutes before the park opened and we had already bought our tickets. The gardens are amazing and they are really worth a visit.

Inhotim is very beautiful and well kept.
We drove from Belo Horizonte and signs to get there from the BR is very difficult to find. Lots of trucks and bad drivers at local road to access the park. Best going by bus. The Entrance fee to the park does NOT include the electric car service to take visitors around.
Lots of hills there and very tiring to walk around. Specially with the hot temperature,
If you don't buy the option to use the cars the same time as you buy your entrance tickets you have no option later to use this service if you change your mind or feel extremely tired. It spoiled our visit since we had a child with us and an elderly person in our group.
The cars service should be included in all tickets and give visitors the option to use them or not.
The restaurant was very elitist and snobbish. I travel a lot around Europe and rarely I sense such a fake refined atmosphere in places like I do in Brazil.
Expensive food, quality was average, and service was very bad. We waited for our bill for a long time and even longer for our change.
Don't want to go back to Inhotim .

Visited this park today. Spectacular ! Didn't care for all the art installations but still interesting. Saw beautiful butterflies, hummingbirds and amazing colourful birds. The park is maliciously clean and tidy. Pay the 25brl for the jump on and off transport otherwise walking will take all day.

A huge outdoor art museum with numerous galleries, installations and botanic highlights. One of the best looked after places I have ever visited in Brazil. Definitely worth paying the R$25 for the transportation (electric cars) as this place really is big! We needed two days to see it all. Wednesdays are free entry. But the R$25 entry fee is very reasonable and worth it.

Imagine the best contemporary art galleries in the world combined with the most exotic and incredible botanical garden. That is Inhotin. Plan for a whole day or two if possible. Also, if you don't like walking a lot or just have one day to visit, hire a private driver that can take you through the park. Is all worth it! Just amazing.

This is a must for anyone visiting nearby. Lush botanical garden with amazing artwork scattered around the grounds. This is a well maintained attraction. Suitable for the whole family and for the whole day or even several days.

This is a fantastic place. The gardens and art work make it a perfect family day out. We went to this area specifically to see the park and my only disappointment was not having two days. The food was also very good. Highly recommend. Don't forget to take your swimming suits as their is a pool for a quick cool off in between art galleries.
I have never been too much into formal art really, but this place really is amazing and interesting!

titulo: Must be what paradise is like
conteudo: More than a museum: in addition to the exhibits laid out around the site, Inhotim is much like a well-manicured botanical garden. Nature is so lush, it is as though we had a glimpse of heaven. Two days minimum are needed to visit fully.
Niece openair 'museum of modern art'. There are facilities of a eletric kart transportation. Good restaurants and a fantastic atmosfere. Good for one full day or a couple of days. I recommend.

titulo: Still the best museum in Brazil
conteudo: It is my second time in Inhotim, and won't be the last. This time the weather was perfect and we enjoyed a lot. It is best combination of a park and art museum.

titulo: Do not ever miss  this rather fantastic outdoor museum !
conteudo: Whenever you fly to Brasil, or you tour inside the country, simply go to Belo Horizonte, Minas Gerais state, and spend one , or better, two days in Inhotim. A 2 hours drive by bus, or one and a half hour by car. Get into( you can buy the tickets in the site beforehand and you can also book internal transfers in small electric cars) and simply forget about the world !!!! Stroll around the magnificent outdoor sculptures and outdoor art. For a brake, have a nice lunch at one of the restaurants, watching to the nice view of the park ! If you decide to spend two days, you can book one of the simple small hotels near the park ( basic ones ) . At the end of the journey, you will feel light, happy and believing in the world ! Do not missi it !

In a spacious ambient, this very organized museum showcase interesting works by many talented artists from all over the world. Among the pieces of art inside and outside walls, there are also beautiful gardens and unique vegetal species.

It is a spectacular open air art museum. I loved it. The staff is friendly and helpful. The landscape is unique. The lakes, the buildings, everything is beautiful. And it is very exciting to explore the park and find out the pieces of art . There is also interesting galleries. You will need two days to see all.

A unique experience combining a beautiful botanical garden and art. You need at least one day and preferably two days. The grounds are vast and there are 23 pavilion scatteredall over, each one of them with interesting modern art from video installations to sculpture, photography and paintings. If you can hire a private (golf type) cart,well worth it.
Amazing combination of art, architecture and botanical gardens. Pay the extra for the golf cart service on hot days and bring swimming clothes - you can swim in two of the artworks!

This outdoor art park is like a Disneyland for adults. Even if you don't like the art, the creativity everywhere will delight: architecture, landscaping, service, food, vegetation, everything. Sets an international level others must beat.

Instituto Inhotim is home to a museological complex featuring a series of pavilions and galleries with works of art and sculptures on display in the open air. Since the outset, Inhotim’s rise on the scene of the Brazilian cultural institutions has been marked by the mission to create an artistic collection and to define new museological strategies that provide the community with access to cultural assets. In this sense, it seeks to bring the public into contact with a relevant set of artworks, produced by artists from different parts of the world, providing an up-to-date reflection on the questions of contemporaneity.

Inhotim is the only Brazilian Institute institution with a world-class collection of contemporary art continuously on display.
This museum truly integrated nature and art provoking in unique way the encounter between mind and soul. You will spend at least 2 days to experience yourself as you tour around the museum.

titulo: To provoke yourself with an art that touches your soul
conteudo:
One of the best places ever to admire art. You find art in each corner which means you need to explore it. The gardens inspire you as well as the galleries.
You will need at least two days, buy transport for the first day and visit all exhibitions in the highest part of the park and let the second day to explore the other down close to the entrance.

This place surprises everyone! It is a huge and beautiful botanical garden with modern art scattered around. You will spend at least 2 days to see and admire it all. Do not miss this place when visiting Brasil and Minas Gerais. It opens at 9:30am and closes around 4:30pm. There are 2 restaurants with excellent food. One buffet style and the other a la carte.
It's amazing place. Very interesting contemporary art and most beautiful botanic garden. It's huge. Best museum in the world!!!

A very interesting place for a walk with a high content of culture due to the vast number of modern art galleries. For sure, one of the most beautiful gardens in Brazil in my opinion.
Good restaurant (Tamboril) serving international cousine, in a pleasant place!
The overal infrastructure is good, with toilets everywhere, coffee shops for a fast snack. The place provide accessibility for disabled people in most of the sightseeings.
Definitely the visit worth every penny.
Better to stay in the city of Brumadinho because after a long day walking, you will get tired to drive back to Belo Horizonte.
Tip: it's advisable to invest 2 days in Inhotim to see everything in a good way.

titulo: Fall in love with contemporary art
conteudo: Grab you map and enter this huge tropical park and find not one but plenty of treasure troves. Inhotim is so large it humbles the biggest golf fields, parks or any other places of leisure you might know. Amidst lush tropical gardens, artists are indulged to have their own galleries, each more stunning than the last. There are so many jewels of sculpture, painting, architecture, big and small, that's impossible to nail any must-see or must-do. And this is the beauty of it all - however fixed an exhibit can be or stable a garden can stay, no ride here is the same. It you are an art addict or if you just want to experience it, the answer is yes - Inhotim pays off.

Inhotim is a large park-museum with top art exhibits, beautiful gardens, fine dining and very good Infrastructure.
It's worth a 2 day visit.

titulo: Art in the most bueatiful gardens you will ever see.
conteudo: One hour drive from Belo Horizonte you will find a magical place - Inhotim (pronounced in-ho-chim). The place is huge, buy the 'cart option' to get you around to the exhibitions or you will only see a fraction of what is on offer. If there is a down side to this place the food options are limited and quite expensive. There were 3 of us, we found a taxi driver who spoke English paid him $R 600 and he was with us for the day (we paid his entry and food etc as well and it was well worth it)

titulo: Everything they say about this place is truth
conteudo: Incredible place! It is hard to define what to call it: open air museum or huge botanical garden or both. The point is not the collections by themselves, but how the place mixes art and nature in a fascinating way. Even if you are not a fan of contemporary art (I certainly am not) you will love to walk around this man-made garden of Eden. If are a fan, you will probably like even more.

titulo: must visit once in a life-time
conteudo: One of the most interesting outdoor museums i've visited. takes a lot of effort and time to get there but its worth the visit particularly if you're into art and design. it's also very beautiful to see some of the oldest nature scenery there.

Travelled here from Belo Horizonte not really know what to expect and loved this place. The highlight of my trip to the state. Would recommend to anyone with an interest in art or just going to nice places. Enjoyed everything about the place the art, the grounds and the food in the restaurant.

Incredible cultural project by this great guy, Bernardo Paz. It is a whole town of contemporary art galleries and fascinating gardens. The infrastructure is growing year by year as more galleries are built. I liked the buildings and the gardens more than the exhibits themselves.

In a long time hadn't I been ti such a magnificent place! Botânical Garden, Park, Open Air Art Gallery? Além that plus undescribable energy coupled to attentive personnel and organization . Simplesmente a must to repeated ever and ever!

Inhotim is the kind of place that no words can describe. Its a incredible mix of art and nature. It's very important that you separate two days to enjoy this place so you can see everything with calm and have some time to appreciate the beautiful nature.

It is a must see for those who enjoy contemparary art and gardens. You must see to believe... Two important comments... buy tickets for the cart for internal transportation and hire a guide. It will save time and provide a full insigth of the works and the story of this park. Good restaurants but if you go during the vacation season or a long week end reservations is a must. The food is very good spacially if you consider it is made for a big crowd. Enjoy.

Nice place , interesting art and beautiful grounds , most touristy place I have seen in Brazil. Clean and lots of helpful people. Food needs work though ! We waited over 30 minutes for pizza , they served some people before us even though they ordered after, they would not serve me Pepsi unless ordered with the meat pizza, and the pizza we ate was soggy mess ! Would rate it a 5 if not for that.

The whole place is a we inspiring. The art galleries are great, the outdoors are incredible, the food is very good, people are friendly. You need two days to knock it all out, but honestly, leave yourself some time to just loaf around. It is worth it.

titulo: Beautiful galleries and more to see
conteudo: There is so much to see within Inhotim that it will take you at least a day or more to see all the galleries. There are several cafes where you can sit down and have lunch or a snack. Make sure you bring a water bottle and a hat if you plan on walking the entire grounds under the hot Brazilian sun! You may want to pack your swimsuit too if you want a dip in a gallery's pool! If you don't like modern art there is still plenty to take in via the gardens but there is something for everyone at this unique place.

titulo: First rate gardens and modern art.
conteudo: Beautiful park, great art, top notch organization. I would recommend two days to see it all. It can get hot, take a water bottle. Keep an eye out for the free guided tours.

titulo: Amazing experience! So much worth it!
conteudo: We spent one full day in this place and we still didn't have the time to visit it entirely. It's an amazing tour, amazing things one can see and things you couldn't imagine to be put together and exhibited in such an extraordinary way. Every room was different, every experience resonated somehow different with each person. So so amazing! It's a must if you are in this area; your senses and feelings will be challenged and you will never forget the experience! I wanna go back again one day. Go there, don't miss it. I promise you it's worth your time.

A must go when visiting Minas Gerais. Extremely interesting open air museum. You'll probably going to need a whole day to see it all. The park is quite big, with lots of attractions and very beautiful gardens.

titulo: Great contemporary art in vast tropical park
conteudo:
Best way to discover the rich Brazilian art scene, lots of pavilions each dedicated to one artist (Brazilians mostly and a few American great names.) It occupies a vast valley with a lake, botanical gardens and greenhouses, many of the pavilions have great architecture so even if you're not an art buff, you'll have plenty to discover. Good restaurants. And an open-air folk music concert in the afternoon!
My recommendations: spend 2 days, get a ticket for the golf carts which connect the groups of pavilions (some paths are a bit steep in the hot sun)

A gorgeous open air museum.
Beautiful landscapes, great galleries, stunning modern art installations that touch all your senses.
A great place to go with friends, family, or our couple.

titulo: Open air museum of modern/contemporary art.
conteudo:
Inhotim is a farm turned into museum.
You need all day to see it all if you are a fast pace walker and probably two days if you like to take your time and analyze art more deeply.

The restaurant opened during my visit was Tamboril and the food was excellent although the price is high for Brazilian standards.

titulo: Landscaping, art and nature, just perfect!
conteudo:
Inhotim is one of the most interesting museums in the world. In practical terms, it is a botanical garden with many art galleries and outdoor sculptures from world famous artists.
The place is very well projected so the landscaping mixes nature and architecture in a harmonic way.

Great place, even if you are not much into modern art. All is very well done, the landscaping, the different buildings, the service, worth visiting; is a place that could easily be in the middle of Germany or France and it would be packed all year round.

titulo: One of the most amazing places I have ever been!!
conteudo: It`s an open air museum!!!There are a lot of sculptures,beautiful gardens and galleries!Art among the grass!!It`s far away from the city capital,but it`s Worth the ride!!Not to be missed!!

titulo: A short drive for modern art
conteudo: Various audio and visual displays of modern art works in a natrual park setting that lies not far from Belo Horizonte

Inhotim is a very beautiful place to visit. It is mix of Art Museum and Botanic Garden, 1,5 hour by car from Belo Horizonte. Nature is awesome in this Cultural Center, there are a lot of different trees and flowers, ducks and geese, little monkeys, birds,... It´s a place where you have to enjoy walking and seeing the nature beside you, with some interesting art galleries and art objects. It´s a place worth going no matter if you are under 10 or above 60... There´s pleasure and activities to everyone.

My tips
- it takes about 2 days to get to know the whole park
- stay in Belo Horinzonte, not in Brumadinho
- if you don´t enjoy walking, take the golf car

Impressionante o espaço, o parque, as estruturas, a organização, a harmonia dos jardins, a beleza do lugar... O parque por si já vale a visita, acrescente a isso obras de arte contemporâneas... SENSACIONAL! Imagino o quanto de prosperidade Inhotim trouxe para a região, super recomendo!
Superb setting, park, infrastructure, organization, harmonious gardens, beauty of the place... The park is worth the visit for itself, but adding to it, contemporary works of art....
AMAZING!! I can only imagine the prosperity Inhotim has brought to the surrounding area, highly recommended!!!

When you hear something about Inhotim, be prepared: Nothing can describe the amazing experience to visit this wonderful place. You need to spend two days for a complete visit. Do not forget to require a tourist guide - usually young and very well trained people.
Food is also marvelous ! There are two options: Tamburil and Oiticica. If you have children, the first will suit better.

I've heard about the inhotim is one of the largest (if not the largest one) open museum open or contemporary arti around the World and, curiously, little known inside Brazilians.
I planned a 2-day visit based on information from the site.
The place is very well organized and signposted. It is a huge area, with breathtaking landscapes and several arts amid these environments. You walk through these gardens seeking several galleries with diverse works, including Yayoi Kusama, Cildo Meireles, Adriana Varejao, among others.
Inside the museum there are some eating options (restaurants and cafeterias).
Some more remote areas are reached with electric cars, where you get them in stations located at various points.
I would suggest two things to museum organizers: (1) to produce a map in perspective rather than the map only with the park layout; (2) the way in which electric cars circulate would be separated from roads which pass people.
It´s better spend 2 whole days to visit Inhotim. A playground for art and nature lovers. Good restaurants and the service is excellent.

titulo: Art in the open. Originality and First World.
conteudo: Fantastic works of art, especially the galleries of Meireles and installing Cardiff & Miller brings a unique experience. Everything is really good including the restaurants.

Inhotim is basically a giant nature reserve where you walk between different buildings/ art galleries. To get there you take a bus (Sariture company) from the main bus station in Belo Horizonte. The trip is about 1:45 hrs, but is well worth it. Bus leaves at 8:15 and returns 17:30. It is about R$40 to get in on peak days and food there is quite expensive, so try go during the week and take a picnic with as there are some beautiful sites to sit and relax. The galleries feature artists from all over the world, and when combined with the modern architecture of the buildings, is quite impressive. Make sure to wear comfortable walking shoes and bring a camera for the scenery, though you can't take photos of most of the exhibits. There are free guided tours in Portuguese only.

The place is magic....you have the impression of arriving in the Eden: a hart of tropical trees and flowers in the middle of the wild Minas Gerais landscape.
.....and, surrounded by these beautiful examples of tropical nature, contemporary art exibitions of great interest! You cannot loose it! Timing requested by the visit: at least one day.

titulo: Beautiful venue - but I am not a modern art fan...
conteudo: This is an amazing large beautiful park interspersed with modern art exhibits. The lovely paths provide great information signs about the foliage. One could easily spend a couple of days here - especially if you are into modern art and spend more time at the exhibits than I did. Some of them are interesting, whimsical --- and quite a few haunting. If you want to see everything and are just here for a day I recommend the bus pass bracelets that will transport you between the areas of the park. VERY tourist focused with lots of amenities (including toilets, eating facilities, coffee shops. gift shops etc.). On a nice day it is a wonderful walk in a park!

Amazing place! Great experience for all family. Well organized, safe, beautiful. We had a young man called Fagner as our guide ( or as they prefer to be called-mediator). Passioned about the place and art made the whole experience even more interesting. Worth the trip took from S.Paulo to Minas Gerais exclusively to visit Inhotim!

titulo: One of the best museums that I´ve ever been!
conteudo: It´s a fantastic open air museum! The art pieces are sensational and the local is very beautiful. It´s a fantastic garden. The Tamboril restaurant is amazing!

I love when wealthy industrialists use their wealth to share beautiful art on their property somewhere out of the way in the world to people around the world. That in a nutshell is Inhotim. It is located in Brumadinho, a bustling city currently lacking the love of the Brazilian government in terms of appearance and welcome, but once you get to Inhotim it is spectacular. Lush, verdant grounds exhibit top notch work inspired by the place. It is a 154-hectare wonderland of discovery. We were told it takes approximately two days to see everything but we were able to do it leisurely in one day and even swam the last hour in one of the swimming pool installations. We did everything on foot, no golf cart, ate at the restaurant, had a snack and finished by 3:30 so we swam the last hour. This is possible if you stay the night before in Brumadinho and come directly when it opens at 9:30a. I think many visitors come from Belo Horizonte airport which is about a 1.5 to 2 hour drive by car with traffic and losing that first couple of hours means the difference of not being able to see everything in one day. The park itself is amazing. There are 3 paths - pink, yellow, orange - to walk in order to see the entire collection of works. Honestly I had a hard time choosing a favorite as each piece evokes a different feeling or reaction. All I can recommend is GO! This is a bucket list must. I just wish that: 1. There was an airport closer to Brumadinho. 2. There are better places to stay in Brumadinho. I hear Inhotim is building a hotel so that's something to look forward to. Love this place.

I am Brazilian, so I can say it by knowledge. I've been travelling around Brazil for a long time, but I've never been to a place like Inhotim. You wouldn't guess that a place like this is located on the country side of Minas Gerais. I was really expecting something much worse, but I found an amazing park, very well organised, full of great art, galleries, vegetation, bodies of water everywhere, very gorgeous landscapes, oh, impressive.
There are 3 restaurants, the cheapest one is called Oiticcica. It is paid by grams on the plate (R$ 53,00/kg) and there is very good food. There is another where you can eat as much as you want for R$ 65,00 and there is one which is a la carte, which I don't know the prices. A coke costs R$ 4,00. At the café, you can have a very good expresso and a pão de queijo (R$ 4,00/each).
I strongly recommend that every tourist around BH take a day or two to go there, and that every living Brazilian also do that. It is very rewarding to see something with such high standards in Brazil.

titulo: Great way to spend the day
conteudo: This is a great way to spend the day relaxing and seeing the beauty of nature. The flora and fauna are the stars, the art just happens to be there also. One advice, if you have any trouble walking, pay the extra to use the in park transportation. I would also advise using it if you are staying for just a few hours in order to see more of the facility.

This open-air museum is something you must see! For us, living just 500 km from here, it was mandatory, and it took us years to plan the trip. Wish I had done it earlier. The location itself is just perfect, you walk for hours in this park filled with indigenous nature, lakes and birds. The exhibits are spread on the huge grounds and can be reached by electric cars available (paid). Being used to walk a lot, we decided that one day was enough (and not using transportation!), but we walked for 7 hours in order to see it all in just a day! It can be done, but if you are with an older person or with kids, we recommend using the cars.
If you're looking for an affordable place to stay, Abba Hotel in Betim is just 30 km away, and our stay there was very nice!

titulo: Amazing for museum buffs and nature lovers alike
conteudo:
Several museums and art galleries scattered across 110 hectares of lush tropical nature. Absolutely stunning, there's nothing like it.
I live nearby in Belo Horizonte, so I have been there a couple of times. I always walk inside the park, which is very pleasant, but I never had the intention of seeing everything in one day. Even if you can do that with the carts, I wouldn't recommend it: it's an amazing place to just relax.
My only problem with it are the restaurants, which are on the expensive side. Picnics are not allowed. That makes it hard for students.

This art center is one of the most popular center of Minas Gerais, beside all the traditional churchs and historycal builds this art center is full of contemporane art and beatiful gardens.
I have been to Inhotim more than 5 times and never is the same, take one day to visit and take your time to admire all the piece of art and the garden,
The restaurant is also very good, a little bit expansive, but very good food.
An incredible day trip just an hour from BH. Full of lush, beautiful greenery, the walking you'll do between exhibits is just as nice and interesting as the works of art themselves.

My mother and I visited Inhotim for the day in late May 2015. The bus trip from Belo Horizonte was efficient (it left exactly on time) and took about an hour. Return trip takes about one and a half hours depending on traffic. The park is fantastic - we loved every part of it. Extremely clean and an amazing collection of plants. Paths are paved and easy to walk with lots of shade. We paid extra for the option of using an hop on, hop off electric cart service for the outer areas of the park. This is a good option for those who want to see everything but who might have trouble with longer distances. The reception area of the park has a shop, bathrooms and luggage storage area. There are numerous restaurants and food kiosks within the park too. There are outside sculptures throughout the park and also big galleries which house certain exhibits - all really interesting and unique.

titulo: One of the most beautiful places
conteudo: What a wonderful surprise. Visiting gardens...museums...fabulous restaurant. They were opening a hotel in the park...we would love to go back and try that....
Very nice landscape, interesting collection of art pieces, better than average on site restaurant. Very pleasant all day long entertainment.
One of the best parks and museums I've ever seen around the world. The park is awesome and the arts exibitions are totally incredible. A must see museum in Brazil and in the world.

titulo: One of the best outdoors museums in the world
conteudo: Inhotim is an outdoors contemporary art museum and also a botanical garden where the art installations and the flora mix and dialogue perfectly. Besides the permanent art works and installations, there are pavilions for temporary exhibitions too, what makes the visit really unique. We hired a group tour for the art exhibition and got the transportation as well because the distances between the buildings are big and we wanted to save time. If you have more than one day for the visit, you can do it by foot, which is very pleasant. The restaurants in Inhotim are very good either the food and the service. I highly recommend Inhotim -- this is really an unique experience.

Definitely one of the most amazing places on earth I've ever seen.

This human masterpiece is a superb combination of selvatic entourage, majestic landscaping. supreme architecture and first-world art masterpieces.

Every detail is carefully attended to make your stay fantastic, from restaurants to toilets.

I would recommend visiting it in at least 2 days as it is a huge park.
There is a 5-star hotel opening soon (2015?), which I can't wait to visit.

A definite MUST-SEE if you are in Brazil!!

If you like nature and quiet, go here. The gardens, the trees, the lakes everything is well cared, and astonishing beautiful. You have a pool that you can use, a place with net to rest, a indoor pool to relax...and the cherry on top of the cake is that on Wednesday is free.... :D. If you are in Belo Horizonte you MUST go here you will not be disappointed!

We spent two days at Inhotim and thoroughly enjoyed it. You need at least two days to do the place justice and to appreciate the outdoor exhibits and the indoor installations. The on site food is of an excellent quality and it would be worth visiting just for the beautiful landscaping.
On the whole, Inhotim is very well organised though we think it would be very useful to have at least one English speaking member of staff at reception. We speak Portuguese so for us there was no problem but we saw lots of international visitors who had difficulties to understand how best to appreciate their visit.
Everything you heard about Inhotim is true. Take at least 2 days (maybe 3 if you want to walk slowly) to enjoy not only the galleries but the amazing outdoors in this beautiful open air museum

titulo: Amazing Museum Not to be Missed
conteudo:
Inhotim is a huge outdoor museum. It's impressive even for people who don't love art. At least a few pieces will really move you.

It can be done in one day, but real art fans may want more. If doing it one day, buy the upgrade for transportation - like large golf carts. They will save you time and some energy, as there are lots of hills. Also consider doing a guided tour, they are free. There are great dining options, from snack bars, to buffets, to sit down restaurants. Try and grab lunch early, as lines form by 1215pm or so.

Get there early and/or buy tickets online. Otherwise, you will wait 20-30 mins to buy tickets and enter.

The drive to Inhotim is on rural, winding roads. Be careful and plan to drive during the day. There are a few small hotels in the area, but I think most people stay in Belo Horizonte about an hour away.

This is by far one of the most amazing places I've ever seen, and for sure the most beautiful park I've ever visited. I can barely decribe it in words: it's like a childhood fantasy of nirvana/paradise. It's a very beautiful place, and one should definitely go, when in Minas Gerais. It is worth the drive :-)

BONUS: the food in their restaurants is magnificent, but it is a bit overprized, compared to normal Brazilian prices.

Inhotim is an art museum open wild. You can get in touch with the art, and some of them you can get inside it. You have to walk a lot inside the museum, so I don't recommend you to take young kids. You have the possibility to use the museum transportation, but you have to pay R$20 (twent reais).

One single day is not enough to see all the marvelous gardens and modern art galleries. Outstanding facilities to all kind of visitors and excellently trained staff. One the oder hand one must be careful choosing where to stay in the region. There are a few good hotels.

The receptionist at my hostel recommended that I go, in fact she said that its something that I should not miss. I was hesitant as Im not much of an art buff but I ended up having the best experience. The park is beyond beautiful, the exhibits are thought provoking - I did not regret going at all! You can take a bus at 815 from Rodoveria and it returns at 430. If you visit the park on Tuesdays and Thursdays, its 50% off, and its free on Wednesdays!

I have blogged about the park - check out my experience! Lots of pictures here too: http://kpari080.tumblr.com/post/115853135850/inhotim

This is an unique place in the world for sure! If you're into arts, make sure to visit Inhotim for at least one day!
My first visit happened May 2011, and the second one November 2014. Unfortunately last time the weather was bad, but anyway we managed to visit most of the pavilions.
I highly recommend splitting your visit in two days, if you plan on seeing everything.
Apart from that bringing a bottle of water, sunscreen and snack, wearing comfy clothes are a must! Do buy the ticket for the internal transport, since the some pavilions are kinda far away.

Is a wonderful place this inmense park-museum where we can spend , at least, two days to visit all buildings with contemporany art and walk around lakes, amazing gardens with a big variety of flowers and trees and with a good estructure of restaurants . Is very good to the body and to the soul .

titulo: Park is outstanding, but I don't recommend
conteudo:
The park is definitely outstanding, tropical vegetation perfectly maintained, all clean, perfect. Amazing nature educated by men. In this, Brazilians are n.1. And restaurant is very very very good (much better than any other we tried in Ouro Preto).
Art is interesting, some installations are gigantic, bur I must say I mostly don't understand or get emotional. Only a couple of galleries really impressed me. But again, I'm totally not an expert.
Having said that, I think it's an interesting visit for those who live in Brasil, but I wouldn't recommend to tourists: you lose hours driving in the middle of nowhere, you need one full day to visit partially (probably 2 days to see it all), but there are hundreds of places in Brasil that you can reach more easily and enjoy more.

titulo: Amazing merge between art and nature
conteudo:
This park is very close to Belo Horizonte and is really worth going. The feeling to a Brazilian ishow could I have taken so long to go there?
It is a beautiful piece of nature with lots of green, small lakes, swans, ...
Among all that, spread throughtout the park, there are over twenty pavillions with all kinds of art, incluing songs, paintings, drawings, pictures and statues. You should not go to Belo Horizonte and not go there!
Service is amazing and everybody is polite. Food could be a little better.

titulo: Wonderful grounds, some interesting galleries, VG service
conteudo: It's huge, and even in most of a day we got nowhere near seeing everything. We coughed up for a golf cart for the day, and it was worth it, with a very helpful guide, Sueli. The galleries are a big mix, some we loved, some not, but it was a memorable day (including the lunch venue).

This is a place where you can spend the day.
It is full of surprises that will blow you away.
The grounds with beautiful landscaping and the pieces
are wonderful.
If you are in Belo Horizonte and have some time, please go...........

It is hard to choose words to give this place a fair description other than what a lot of users have already said. Scenery is spectacular, galleries and open air works are great (even if you will find some odd) and overall it easily makes for a very pleasant two-or-three-day visit.

Aspects it could improve: accessibility (many galeries are hard or impossible to reach for disabled people) and the electric carts you pay for as an extra (they have somewhat bizarre itineraries and are not that useful if you are really tired or can't, for any reason, walk).

If it were possible, I would give it 4,5 stars, just for that.

The kilo restaurant must also improve. At more than R$ 50 per kg, it could have better fare - meat, particularly, was awful the two days I went there.

Tip: I would certainly spend two days - one without the cart for the nearer places and one with it to visit the more distant galleries and points.
Three hours were most def not enough to see what this contemporary art wonderland has to offer! I will most def have to return to see more of it! Stunning place, never been anywhere like it!

Finally an amazing place in my country that made me speechless. Even if you don't like arts, you'll get impressed. I highly recommend to visit Inhotim. It's not easy to get there, the city where the park is located called Brumadinho has no infrastructure at all for visitors, as a Brazilian I was feeling left without options. It's very hard to move around, there are no restaurants, the hotels are average. The local people are extremely nice and gentle, but there is clearly a lack of services considering the number of people who visit the place daily. My suggestion is that you stay in a hotel in Belo Horizonte and take a direct bus to Inhotim. Two days are enough.

titulo: Hidden gem located 60 km from Belo Horizonte
conteudo:
You will need two days to visit this open-air art museum. Actually, Inhotim is more than this. It blends modern architecture and contemporary art galleries into a beautiful tropical garden landscape. The lush vegetation and well maintained gardens make an unforgetable contrast with modern gallery buildings and art installations scattered across the 110-hectare area. Some tips:
. Although it is possible to squeeze the visit to just one day (check-in by the 9:30 AM opening time and hire a private cart), I think you will miss the mind-refreshing experience to leisurely wander through the pathways appreciating nature and art at the sametime. Two days will allow you to enjoy your stay, take pictures and eventually participate in guided tours or attending workshops if you have some Portuguese language knowledge.
. There are two restaurants with very decent food. However, they will be crowded during weekends and holidays. Try to arrive by noon time. The less central Oiticica restaurant may have a shorter waiting time during peak hours. Other options are the many snack and sandwich places spread through-out the area. Picnics are not allowed.
. Purchasing the cart ticket will save you time and energy, as the park is located in a hilly terrain. There are pre-set stops, and waiting times were acceptable (less than 5 minutes) during our visit during Carnaval.

We were told to visit inhotim by friends of ours and it was definitely worth it! One of the most beautiful places I have visited. The people working there are extremely helpful and the place is so vast that at times it feels that you have this park all to yourself. The buffet restaurant we tried inside was fantastic though probably pricey for Brazilian standards. The mix of contemporary art and luxurious vegetation is a fantastic one. Worth the trip to brumadinho

The mix of art and nature works far better than I could have hoped. It's a bit remote but so good it's worth a trip to South America just by itself. I was there for two half-days and it wasn't enough. Take at least two days to really enjoy it. And bring swimming suits.

This place, like all my Brazilian friends say, doesn't even look like Brazil. It has it all: beautiful landscape, marvelous gardens mixed with native plants and flowers, a wonderful mix of dirt and paved pathways, clean bathrooms everywhere, a nice restaurant, many smaller snack places and cafes, it's well organized and perfectly signaled. Everything was good, making this place a perfect getaway from the city, for families, couples, groups of friends and to go by yourself as well. The artworks are mostly interesting and fun. It's well worth the trip, or trips, as this is something to visit many times.

I toured this museum for 5 hours and I felt I could have been there for 10! It is a museum for all of the senses from smells, sounds and the like. My favorite experiences was the Red Room, the mirrored building and the sound room with a microphone buried 200M under the earth and plays the sound from there. Also the telescope was a great photo op although as an art piece it was not that interesting. Do yourself the favor of buying the transportation along with your entry. Drink a few waters before entering the park because this place is as large as Disney World. Alot of walking so come prepared. This is the type of experience that you do alot of walking, alot of reflecting and alot of photographing.

Read the reviews and be inspired! Take a break and give yourself a treat - take a couple of days to look at exciting contemporary art in the Garden of Eden. We recommend you pay a little extra for short rides from point to point on a hot day. Excellent food in the restaurants. A place that definitely should be on everybody's bucket list.

This is one of these places that you don't think you can find in Brasil, as far as art is concerned. The park itself is huge, so I decided to pay for a private troller in order to be able to visit as much as possible of the park in one day. There are a lot of different kinds of contemporary art spread all over the place. The guides are professional, kind and the service is good, which is very rare in Brasil. I highly recommend

- Located in Brumadinho, 60 km from Belo Horizonte, Inhotim has many breathtaking art installations. It´s all about a giant open-air art gallery set amid of botanical gardens designed by Burle Marx with a collection of around 4.500 exotic species.

- Opens Tuesdays to Fridays (09:30 to 16:30 h) and Saturdays/Sundays/Holidays (09:30 to 17:30 h)

- It´s impossible to visit the entire extension in one day, I recommend 2 days. The entrance ticket cost R$ 20/30 (full price) and R$ 10/15 (half price) depending if it is weekday or weekend/holiday. Golf carts drive visitors between pavilions; you must buy a one-day ticket for R$ 20. It helps a lot, specially when the sun is hard over there! If you prefer you can book in advance a tour with your own guide and golf cart (R$R$R$).

- There are toilets, water fountais and snacks bars at several points. I have visited twice: the first time I ate at Oiticica restaurant (self-service; 52,90 R$/kg) and this time at Tamboril (buffet; 67 R$/person and 12 R$/dessert).

I definitely recommend a visit to this cultural eden!

titulo: Best kept secret for modern art and nature lovers.
conteudo: After long consideration the four of us decided to make this is a day visit from Belo Horizonte - a wise decision. There is a 1 1/2 hour bus service (Saritur will take you there from Tuesday through Sunday leaving the bus station in Belo Horizonte at 8:30AM. The return trip from the Institute departs from Tuesday to Friday at 4:15PM and at 5:00PM on Saturday and Sunday, matching the opening hours of the park). You could spend a little less and a lot more there whether you go for the nature aspect (better in my view than the Rio Botanic Gardens) or the art which is wide ranging and often exciting, to suit diverging tastes. Why it is a secret even for Brazilian tour agents, is a mystery. Even Wikipedia does not mention it as a possible excursion from BH. Must get a shuttle bus ticket (well worth it) if you want to cover the whole area without running all day, but probably not worth buying the individual cart version, unless you really want to be independent and avoid the few minutes wait at each boarding point. Many decent food outlets, including posh restaurants and buffets and snacks and drinks. Don't go on a Tuesday, if you want to avoid the biggest crowds when it is free for students.

Inhotim is a great place for contemporary art lovers and nature addicts. The different exhibitions are all different (I'll let you discover them) and the paths are really nice. Take a whole day to discover every little place in this giant open air museum.

if you love contemporary art, it is the place. if you love great garden, it is the place. if you love good restaurant, it is also the place (i recommend tamboril, with a good buffet). inhotim is immense, the galleries sometimes very far from the entrance. so i recommend to take a ticket (20 reals) for free transportation, especially for the sony and doug aitken installation permit you to hear the sound of the earth! other amazing installations are the two music works of janet cardiff (also a mix of art and technology). it is worth to have a look on the chris burden beam drop, also very far from the entrance and then, in belo horizonte, to see the video of this spectacular installation (museum of contemporary art).
Run, run run do not miss this museum. Maybe the world's greatest outdoor contemporary art museum . . .

Really amazing, it is incredible that someone has managed to build something like this. The garden is stunning, it does not really matter if you like the art or not. It is amazing to see such a large well-maintained place with so many beautiful buildings just for art. I must say that I enjoyed perhaps 20% or so of the works of art, but the whole set-up is so beautiful, that I just loved it. That said, I believe one day is enough.
Also, the place is relatively far from Belo Horizonte, so you have to stay there several hours to enjoy it, and therefore you need to have lunch there. There are two restaurants and although it is a buffet system, the food is fantastic. However, the restaurants are always crowded and the service is chaotic, so you have to be prepared to spend a long time in huge lines.
Also important: the place is huge, so it is crucial to purchase the ticket for internal transportation (there are lots of golf carts that can take you anywhere).

titulo: Great Art Collection and amazing garden
conteudo:
Tuesdays are free for everyone!
There's a bus going from Belo Horizonte (Central bus station)to the museum everyday and returning.
